2016-12-07,0,0,114,False,Recommended,Survivors must work together to turn on a series of generators located in the maze like compound in which the game takes place all while hiding from the killer or fleeing for their lives if spotted. Once enough generators are powered up the doors to the compound open and the survivors next task is to find the door and escape with zero voice or text communication. For the killer his task is to hunt down the survivors knock them down and carry them to and place them on one of many meat hooks located throughout the level. Once hooked survivors slowly begin to bleed out though they may be rescued by other survivors should they display an altruistic streak to their in game personality.To balance the struggle between good and evil the killer s view is first person while the survivors enjoy a third person perspective giving them the informational advantage over the killer due to their much wider field of view. Actions in game be they altruistic or self interested reward the player with points used for character progression allowing them to acquire tools and abilities. The game also features competitive elo based matchmaking to ensure that in each game players come up against opponents of similar skill.Graphically this game is on par with many of the Triple A titles unveiled at E3 this year with gorgeous lighting high res textures and well designed UI. This doesn t seem to come at a cost to performance an issue which plagues other first release indie games with many users reporting stable frame rates above 30 fps across the board. Gory visuals and strong killer style really make the prospect of being caught as a survivor horribly frightening.Sound cues are an important feature in Dead by Daylight and as one would expect from the creators of Star Citizen the sound in game is both well conceived and well implemented to create the game s immersive feel. Survivors hear their heartbeat grow louder and louder as the killer draws near. This coupled with a crescendo of the standard horror score fare instills the unfortunate survivor with a strong sense of panic as he/she struggles to finish powering on a generator or rescuing a hooked teammate.The game s design may hurt its success unfortunately. Survivors can work together but are by no means a real team . No in game voice/text chat support means that when you re in you re on your own. This choice does however give advantages to the impatient player. When a survivor is either dead or has escaped they can immediately find another match instead of having to wait for the match s conclusion as in many other team based multiplayer games.,Dead by Daylight

Survivors must now follow a meta.Anything that gets proposed to reduce the overall meta of the game which is nurse/billy for killers and Decisive Strike/Sprint Burst/Self care perks for survivors.... neither side of the community will agree on their metas being nerfed (killer mains will defend the top killers survivor mains will defend the top survivor perks).... so the devs always bait themselves into this viscious cycle of always choosing the side that cried the loudest for the other side to be nerfed (resulting in an imbalanced game)... and this has been going back and forth for years. It calmed down 6 months ago (nearly 40k people were playing back then... we're down to 20k ish) but now we've had so many perks/killers kicked out from being viable (the survivors learnt how to counter doctor and huntress at this point... they're not really viable... only full proof huntresses remain and they're rarer than a full proof nurse... whom would still be stronger).Overall... the devs are too afraid to make balance changes for the game because they fear a backlash from either side... the only changes they make are to further nerf perks barely anyone was using. 2017-01-18,0,0,1773,False,Recommended,1000 Hours / 1 year review Noveember 12 201742 of the last 365 days of my life have been right here playing Dead By Daylight. More than 11% of the year. If that doesn't say how much I like this game I don't know what will.If you're looking for a game that's multiplayer and different than all your others then you're going to like this game. Most of the multiplayers my friends and I played were FPS but this was far from that. That's probably why it was so intriguing and dragged me in.I play this game every day for at least a couple hours. Either I have no life or I just love to play this game. I must say I did not get into this game when I first started playing it. &lt 10 hours in this game and I was not a fan. The tutorial (or lack thereof) was terrible and it did not prepare me to play this game. Once I figured out how to play I was playing daily mastering the skills it takes to play and becoming better and better. You can do the same if you put the time in. WATCH STREAMERS if you want to learn how to play quickly. A mistake I made was not watching people stream this game when I first started playing. It is a very entertaining game to watch people stream as well as it'll give you some good tactics to take with you in the game. Plus they aren't opposed to you asking them questions. I'll put a list of recommended streamers at the bottom of this section so you can know who will be good to watch.In this game you're living in a horror movie each game. With one killer trying to kill you and your 4 friends. The killer is different each time and every game you play feels different. This is the aspect that Friday the 13th missed. Their game is always the same and you can't effectively choose who you want to play as. If you want to play killer you play killer. If you want to play survivor you play survivor. There can be multiple of the same survivor skin in each game too so everyone can go in as the same character and you don't have to sacrifice playing as your favorite character.This game is exciting toxic and unique all at once. I started this game when trappers could trap your feet and facecamping was 90% of the games. I've been through the lobby simulator and came out on the other side. I keep coming back to this game and I love it.The community can be super toxic but I've made a lot of friends through this game. Ironically most of the friends I've made has been as their killer.The game has definitely improved from when I started playing. Survive With Friends works the majority of the time now the game is fairly balanced on both sides as it stands. I get both killer and survivor to rank 1 in each reset if I put the time into the game.Streamers to watch Survivors 72hrs The original juke god. Although he doesn't play too much at this time you can watch his youtube videos to see some good juking. As many are old some of the jukes might not be able to performed in current game.Swind420 3500+ hours in game and streams dailySlickfoo Amazing jukerPickleDream She'll give you a pickle if you ask nicelyCrunchyeggrollzz Survivor mainOhTofu Former killer main gone survivorUnumz Former killer main gone survivorMorf_uk Mustache man with the jukes at handJendenise One of the most followed / subbed DBD streamersNo0b3 Mainly a youtuber. Super toxic survivor gameplays.Techguru808 Super funny and underviewedThere are a lot of other streamers some bigger than the ones I listed. But theses are the ones I mainly watch and they are really good at the game.The cool thing about Dead By Daylight is playing with streamers. I've played with/against all of the people listed above except Morf.Killers A lot of good killer mains have gone to the survivor side.Hexy (formerly sxyhxy) Trying to stay true to killer lately but he does a lot of survivorOhtofu Lots of survivor games as of lateHybridPanda Cross survivor / killerMarth88 One of few killer mains who continues to play mostly killerTheSwiftLegend Nurse mainI hope this helps you and I'll see you all in the fog!100 Hours Review January 18th 2017If you're looking for a thrilling competitive and sometimes scary game then this will be greatly suited for you.DBD (Dead By Daylight) is a 4v1 competition game where up to 4 survivors attempt to turn on generators and open an exit to whatever map they are on. While the 1 killer is trying to track down attack and sacrifice these survivors. Players must use their whit tools and perks to survive and win each match. The survivors and killers each have their own unique abilities to help them win.Each match feels somewhat new and fresh. You play with new people with a ranking system designed to try and match you with players of the same skill level. The generators will randomly appear on each map so you always have to look for them there's multiple different maps to play on each killer has specials that they can use IE the trapper lays bear traps nurse can basically teleport a short distance Michael Myers is more stealthy etc. You have to learn each of their strengths to play well as either survivor or killer. The game is meant to be challenging on both sides. If you can easily escape the killer and win everytime it wouldn't be fun. If you die by the killer every game it wouldn't be fun either.CONS MatchmakingThis game is great when you are able to play. Sadly while the gameplay itself is quite fun often times the game will glitch and put you in a loading screen that doesn't end when trying to find a solo match. You will have to force close the game and open it and try again. The current fix to this is to Survive W/ Friends but hit Ready and don't invite anyone. It works a lot better to try and find games this way. When trying to find games w/ friends sometimes it'll kick you all back to the lobby when it acts like it finds a game. You have to reinvite anyone you're playing with and requeue whenever this happens. Really the biggest flaw this game has is the headache of trying to find a match sometimes.Overall I would recommend this game if you have the patience to deal with the current matchmaking problems (been dealing with this for the 3 months I've been playing.) Hopefully the devs can fix it soon!,Dead by Daylight

2017-08-18,0,0,476,False,Not Recommended,It is my personal opinion that the devoplers of this game does not care about the feed back provided by the community. I have played the game off and on for about a year now and I can honestly tell you that it gets worse with every up date. The game is clearly sided toward survivors those that play with friends. The killer being a sole player has perks with limited set up or at best particular circumstances that need to be met where as survivors get always powered perks or ways to constantly thwart all killers not just some. This makes having a playing a particular killer worthless. Now some can play this game and some can do well. Those are the people that have the time to invest above what a casual player can really offer. If you're going to play. Play survivor because everything is geared towards thwarting the killer verses sneaking around and avoiding the killer like it should be and like it was that drew so many players in the first place. It used to be a game of strategy and you could get scared about getting caught. But thanks to the work of developers it is now a game that survivors can litterally taunt a killer all game and unless you're an allstar pro and even if you are you can lose because a group of people decide to constantly blind you with a common item like flash lights. Or have perks that cann take being hit several times depending on the combination. This game is clearly unbalanced and I will not be returning or recommending this game to anyone.10/21/17I attempted to come back after a few DLCs and try out some of the new changes. At this poinnt and time I still find the killer survivor process unbalanced. One survivor can thwart the entire process with a simple flashlight that can be obtained through basic leveling. There is no real skill in the process either. They introduced blood lust which I feel was a step in the right direction but it can take to long to obtain the needed speed and dependent upon map layout it will break to easily or not pick up players clearly infront of the killer. I have played both survivor and killer and I feel that even with the new additions they still are not focusing on the aspect of the game they're selling. 1 killer against 4 survivors. The concept should be that the killer is stronger better faster and scary. It feels they've tweaked hear and there but still do not offer anything remotely close to a decent game. Half the time I do things as a killer because I am worried about what a survivor might do to me. How is that fair I ask? 2016-06-29,0,0,4,False,Not Recommended,"It turns out the way to survive a serial killer is to just run in circles jumping in and out of the same window. Who knew.In essence this game is trash. Unless you have a special offeriing (an expendable one time use item) you cannot actually kill anyone yourself. You have to drag them to a hook to sacrifice them. 2017-10-15,0,0,405,False,Not Recommended,Killers The Doctor killer is broken and not fun to play against. You scream when you're within the terror radius easily exposing you to the killer. If he's tunneling/chasing you when you're in insanity level 3 (Which he easily puts you in as the shock goes through every object/wall) you have little chance of escaping him and snaping out of it without screaming thus giving you away all over again. Not being able to pallet slam or interact with anything in insanity 3 is rage inducing. The Hag plants too many traps. Annoying for late game with few generators. Especially when they are close together. Freddy doesn't work for this game. He's has too much of an advantage and it's not fun playing against him.1.) Totally invisible unlike wraith's translucent blob so you can't even tell if he sees you without wasting a perk slot. 2.) The children humming (terror radius sound) isn't directional so you don't have a sense of where he is or if he can see you. Looking at blades of grass to track his movement isn't reliable because most maps are barely grassy. (Mostly patchy grass here and there among mostly flat ground.)3.) His putting people to sleep gimick is terrible. He can always see you in dreamland. You have to stay in his terror radius meaning you can't reasonably wake yourself up blowing generators or having someone snap you awake or self heal without him hearing it. Everything in dreamworld is slower so relying on skill checks isn't happening. He'll easily hear you if you're injured so that makes things even more impossible. If you somehow get woken up he'll just quickly pull you back to sleep. Finding games where killers camp hooked survivours are common.Perks/Offerings Hex Ruin is too common and shouldn't apply to all survivors. If you play this game on a wireless network it's bad enough missing regular skill checks can be frequent. Other Hugely annoying Bad lobby system. The amount of time wasted manually inviting people and telling people to accept their damn invite adds up a lot (Additional time telling people who aren't afk to ready up). Dev's need to add an option for people in the post game lobby to to back out with friends (to a new lobby). Trap door is nearly impossible to hear even with headphones on. (Ambient audio is over powering). Generators often spawn in bad locations (often 3 too close together. Unless you're playing with 3 other friends this can get you screwed over late game).Not a bad game but there's a lot of inconvenient things add up.Hiding from killers and being chased/escaping killers is fun but a fair ammount of killers ruin one or both those things (Doctor &amp Freddy enemies with too long a range for melee attacks.),Dead by Daylight

2016-09-29,0,0,136,False,Not Recommended,Overall the concept of this game is great you and three other people are to repair broken generators across the map while avoiding a killer. But that's where my appreciation for this game stops. I've pumped out a lot of gameplay in the past few weeks trying to force myself to like the game but there's simply too many issues with it right now for it to be playable. At first it seemed as if the devs were taking into account the communities complaints and fixing things based off of their suggestions but the past few weeks this has seemed to stop. The biggest issues of the game in my opinion While their update claims to have 'fixed' the matchmaking issues finding a game can still be excessively long and will often throw you into a game where you're playing people across the world. Game is currently incredibly unbalanced IMO makes it more frustrating than fun to play. Some perks need to be evened out a lot more and there absolutely needs to be a consequence for killers camping people who are hooked. Graphics customization is very limited as well as sound balancing. The main menu music is incredibly annoying and can't be individually turned down. Matchmaking has a HUGE skill gap. I'm either in a game with brand new players or people with 400 hours in game there isn't really an inbetween. TL DR at the moment I wouldn't spend the $20 on this game it's not quite a finished product yet. I think if some of these issues (along with others) are addressed it will be a really fun game. But for now I wouldn't bother.,Dead by Daylight

2017-02-04,0,0,119,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight is bad game. Still fun tho.tl dr An amazing survival horror experience and my favourite indie game so far this year you ll sure as hell see this one on my list of top 5 games of 2016. The seeds of greatness are here but with plenty of room for refinement and clarity to improve the experience. Dead by Daylight is a good game but it lacks of content. Hope to see more soon. It lacks polish but Dead by Daylight is a genuinely tense ode to 80s slasher movies. Despite of lack of content in its launch Dead by Daylight is an original adventure multiplayer game that it is worth and captures perfectly the style of classic movies of horror. Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well but only to a point. The idea is great and it's really intense and fun when played with friends. However it's not the most polished experience so it might be worth waiting and seeing how it improves in the upcoming months. Disastrous scoring system encourages some players to cooperate with the killer instead of running from him and reduces promising gameplay to nonsense (e.g. when the killer picks you up throws you into a trap resets it picks you up throws you into a trap resets it picks you up throws you into a trap resets it picks you up...). 09/2016 p.58 Dead By Daylight is a fantastic concept that in practice needed much more work put into it. None of this stops Dead by Daylight from being enjoyable at times or even tense but a horror experience it is not. Nor is it particularly well fleshed out well documented or even well executed. Game would probably be amazing if they had bothered to do any optimization at all. The graphics settings are preset so literally the only thing you can do to optimize it yourself is choose 'Low Med High Ultra' but even on the lowest settings a decent rig will struggle. More than a few people on Reddit and Steam have stated that the framerates are subpar with a unanimous. I have never played such a good horror game before. Resident Evil was fine and Dead Space too but I see a potential on this game. Keep up the good work Awesome game and Awesome Idea. There always gonna be bad feedback but that doesn't mean anything. Everything takes time to be improved. I hope all you guys like it! Good Luck Getting Away From The Killer! DbD creates a a very tense atmosphere in particular as a survivor where you walk around and try to avoid drawing attention to yourself. The difference in perspective (Survivor in 3rd person killer in 1st person) feels strange to start with but quickly feels very natural and well balances the different roles. First game in a long time that has given me jump scares and keeps me coming back for more. Very boring and is somewhat fun it's no element of surprise graphics are bad and it feels like a rushed version of something that could've been way more fun and I believe it tried to rush out from the Friday the 13th that's why the game has some bugs and just doesn't feel the best especially the graphics.Awesome premise and tight gameplay but definitely needs updated content from some free DLC's to make a decent following that could expand the franchise profitably it doesn't cut it for a full release even one at budget price.,Dead by Daylight

2018-10-07,0,0,31,False,Not Recommended,"The gameplay and the idea of this game is fantastic !Each game can be unique because of the perks and the different killers so the game has an incredible replayability because of that.It also has a good learning curve when you're learning the game as well as unlocking perks which make you play differently.But that's just the theory.In fact the game is a pain to play and is a frustrating experience both for killers and survivors.First the matchmaking is a totally mess. As a fresh new player with maximum 5 hours playtime you can be matched against a player with full tier 3 teachables perks memento mori and 100+ hours playtime.Then the devs aren't listening to their players (another one) and are praising things that makes no sense. For example killers that are camping when you can't do anything and is a """"""""legit strategy"""""""" for the devs. Survivors also have their incredibles strategy like looping with a pallet/window for 5 minutes. And then when you think you can catch them there's the 'Decisive Strike' perk or/and their torch. For this last thing they could only buff bloodlust but who cares to have fun right ?Next there are performances issues and bugs.The menu is clear and simple. In the game the map is pretty small constituted by the same tiles every games and there's not a lot of visual effects.But Dead by Daylight manages to take forever to load every single thing on the game (menu included) and it needs to be low/medium on graphics to be played correctly while i'm playing openworld games on high way more beautiful than this game.We can also mention that there's no dedicated server which means you're likely to play an unplayable game as a survivor if you have a high ping with the killer hosting the game.For the bugs I can say there's the ""lobby bug"" that is a thing for something about 1 year I think which consist of a lobby that has 3 survivors but the last won't join until one leaves which makes froze lobbies for nothing. It's a real bug since you can quit and relog instantly on a lobby that is full in a second.There are also bugs while loading when your game exits without saying anything.When you're playing with friends as survivors there is also something that annoy me which is the fact that you need to reinvite your friend in a new lobby everygame or every time you leave a bugged lobby (1/2 of lobbies) which make a flood of invitations on the game chat history. I don't know why the game can't remember a group Deceit is doing that great why not Dead By Daylight a paid game with DLC and IAP.Last but not least I think that the economy system of this game is a complete joke. If you're not buying the game with all its DLC it will be a disadvantage because you will miss powerful perks that you can unlock by playing DLC survivors or killers like 'Ruin' which is completely OP or 'Haunted Ground' and 'Barbecue &amp Chilli'.Some will say you can unlock these perks in the 'The Shrine of Secrets' which is right but you'll need patience because you can wait 3 month before there's something good in this.Anyway I think this would be advertised as well as the IAP on a non f2p game (even if it's cosmetic) because I totally think it's a scam since it's worse than a p2w system.",Dead by Daylight

They listen to their audience and use hard numbers to try and balance things just right.The power trip of beating people to death and the feeling of escaping unscathed on either side of the fence are just great experiences. For such a cheap price it provides a lot of fun.,Dead by Daylight

2018-01-07,2,2,772,False,Not Recommended,"Overall score 2.5/10Let me preface this review by saying I USED to LOVE this game. Before we got patch 1.4 the game was in a stable but still enjoyable state. I'll give you the problems it had then and still has now in a minute but I wanted to get that out of the way first.Back then survivors had to avoid the killer or they would die quickly losing their pips and going down in rank instead of up and they knew it. Back then killers were't overpowered but most still needed some bandages to their kits to help them out and even then every killer had a playstyle. Let me go ahead and list out the good the bad (What could easily be fixed) And the ugly (What clearly needs to be addressed ASAP)The good*Depending on your experience with your killer of choice you can be EXTREMELY powerful. As for myself I am a Hag and Huntress main and do not regret it. Both are solid killers with playstyles I like.*Graphics are very solid. Prestiging killers especially feels rewarding with bloodied clothing or new items to use for customization and bloody weapons actually drip blood if you pay attention to them. *Map generation is almost always randomized and you will almost never get the same map twice because of it.*Windows block survivors after they or the killer total 3 vaults over it.The bad*The devs never solved the problem of ""Infinites."" Infinites are basically pregenerated map pieces that include pallets and windows in specific places making actually catching the survivor take a MUCH longer time to do wasting the killer's time. More on that in a minute. There was a minor change to map generation to help solve this but it did not work.*Some killers are completely outclassed. The Wraith the Shape and The Nightmare are the ones I'm looking at here. All three have decent kits but with infinites being a huge problem right now they can almost never get a kill.The UGLY*Pallet Looping is an absurd problem and if you don't know why go watch someone streaming this game as a killer and I guarantee it will happen in every game. ""Pallet Looping"" refers to a tactic when the survivors use hitboxes to their advantage. How? Survivor hitboxes are smaller than the killer and any area with pallets will have something else around to act as obstacles. Trees boxes things of that nature. The survivors can run laps around such things and since their hitbox is smaller than the killer's they can not only gain ground this way but they can also decide to wait for the killer and throw the pallet down to stun them but if it were just one pallet it wouldn't be too bad. Most of the areas on the maps have more than one pallet in close proximity and survivors will loop the killers around EVERY ONE of them to waste their time. Which leads me into...*Time. To escape survivors have to repair five of seven generators which doesn't sound too bad. Four survivors one killer and the gens take a decent amount of time to repair. But coupled with infinites and pallet looping you will watch multiple generators get done in the time it takes you to down even one survivor if they have half a brain and loop you well. To actually KILL a survivor you need to either (A) Mori them after they have been hooked once (B) let them bleed out on the ground which takes about 2 3 minutes total or (C) hook them until the entity sacrifices them which can be up to 3 times depending on how altruistic the other survivors are. Why is this a problem? Here are your options.(A) Down a survivor and camp them which they will then spam the struggle button instead of hold it so they raise their arms up and down alerting their friends (Who can see this arm waving) that you are there and to do generators(B) Hook a survivor and walk away which will prompt one of their friends to save them and let them start infiniting you again*Survivors WILL be s to you. This is a fact of life. With multiple clearly overpowered perks and no counters to any of them survivors know that THEY are in control of the game not you. Yeah you can kill them as the killer but killing even one rank 1 survivor with the game in the state it is in will cost you the entire game and you will sit there watching them T bag you taunt you stun you with flashlights/pallets and constantly get away from you for FREE laughing at you the entire time. Closing statements? The game right now is NOT worth playing. As a player with over 650 hours and counting in hopes the game recovers at the moment I would say wait for it to be on a heavy sale if you REALLY want it but otherwise go play something else. The killers are supposed to make you be afraid of them they are supposed to be the ones in control and with the power but the way the game is right now there's nothing they can do. Survivors are constantly getting buffs and killers are getting nerfed and the devs will not address the clear problems that would solve the issues killers face to make the game fun on both sides. Nobody wants to get trolled every game being frustrated and angry that they cant kill a single survivor. It will make you extremely unhappy and make you feel like you wasted your money.If the devs fix pallet looping and put decisive strike back the way it was (Where only the obsession can use it) then the game can go back to a state of relative balance. Killers will be back where they belong as the ones in control. Until that happens save your money and spend it on something better. If I see relative improvement I would happily recommend this game and would gladly change the way I see it.",Dead by Daylight

2017-09-14,0,0,3,False,Not Recommended,"Product received for free. Amended the review Original Game is free for 5 days you'd think there'd be people.... just waited 15 mins as a survivor with a blinking ""waiting"" sign once i finished reading reviews on my phone and nothing had happened (still alone in my ""waiting"" lobby no one came and went) the game wouldn't even let me leave the waiting queue (esc made a sound.... but nothing else) had to go click the windows taskbar close for the game to offer me the option to quit.Might try it again at prime time... but it currently smells like a dead fish.Edit So i did get to play a few rounds it's ok. I played mostly with noobs like myself and it felt balanced... but at the cost of anoying handicaps.As a survivor you either are on the radar or not... which means you're free to do what you want or doomed to run trying to outrun a killer that is slightly faster than you. Only way to escape is by dropping obstacles (which hulks should be able to just pass... but they can't) or use the poor visibility to get out of sight.As a killer you're just roaming untill you see a rabbit... if they see you they run if they don't it's a free hit... but just one cause you always wipe your blade an enoying habit that is basically a stun you can't even trun the camera to keep track of your prey I often lost it that way frustrating. The killer abilities are ok.... but not very helpfull. One can lay traps... which seldom get triggered one can stealth and increase speed... but is somewhat stunned when he leaves the state (and rings a bell) so it's only really usefull on newbies but at least it helps getting in the vicinity of victims faster.All in all I feel that there isn't very much depth in the game. The concept is fun if you like playing hide and seek but there are many frustrating balances (like if a prey you captured flees from your arms... you're yes stunned). And the execution mechanism makes it so a well organised team will manage to flee quite easily or take down the generators if you camp the victim cause it's way too fast to release them (you'd think being impaled would slow down people..).So yeah I remain on my negative review it can be fun but there's a lot of frustration points and well the theme is offputting to be honnest.Bonus tried to log on again this friday... servers offline....ok.... there's no exit button esc only tries to connect you again so back to manual close GG.",Dead by Daylight

2017-10-07,0,0,322,False,Recommended,It's just so unique. 4v1 multiplayer and one person plays as a serial killer. Minimalist HUD and dark spooky atmosphere make it the most immersive multiplayer game I've ever played. It will scare you if you play it right. It has a bunch of RPG elements that I don't care for. New players are at a distinct disadvantage because you have to level your characters up before they are competitive. The rules are also kind of... vague which leads to a lot of players getting mad if they don't think you played the game right. Communication isn't allowed in game which gives an UNBELIEVABLE advantage to people who play with friends and communicate on Discord. A really stupid design idea imo. It does add to immersion but that isn't worth it at the expense of competitiveness.Overall the game is so cheap and unique that I still recommend it despite its flaws. It is the best scary multiplayer game I've played in a few years. 2017-07-16,0,0,1,False,Not Recommended,"On paper this game should be awesome but it isn't.The idea where there is a killer (tank ish) and you are hunting survivors sounds awesome. However in the execution is where this game falls apart.When you are the killer you're suppose to be this unstoppable monster that is something to be feared. The reality is that you couldn't kill a fly. You can only down the other players once downed you must then hang them on a post where after a long period of time they will die. Yes you can't actually kill anything yourself. Even when you get someone with your chainsaw you only down them.It wouldn't be so bad if it actually meant something to be placed on the post/alter. It takes somewhere around 2 minutes for someone to die on it. That might not seem like much but the objective for the survivors is to turn on 5 6 engines. You can either go after those survivors or watch your ""hung"" survivor die. I bring this up because it is painfully easy for someone to get off the post once they've been placed there. Either they have a perk or they have another player get them down. In which case after a quick heal it's like they were never downed.This would be forgivable if there was actually any tension in the game but again there isn't. You and the killer are only slightly faster than the survivors and I mean this marginally. If you take one small turn off they will have grown the lead. You can spend an entire match chasing a single person in circles and never hit them. Which brings us to the next issue as the killer it takes two hits to down someone. The reach of your weapon is very small you have to be right on top of someone to hit them. This combined with the fact that you are only a percent faster than the survivors means good luck actually getting a hit.Each map is essentially a square with various objects inside it none of which you can really interact with. Every map feels the same and are devoid of any interesting features for either the survivors to use or the killer.There is potential here if some of these issues could be fixed. Starting with making the killer something to be feared. I could go on but I've already given this more time then I would like.",Dead by Daylight

The game is actually pretty fun when the killer and survivors are fairly new at the game. The reason for this is because the killer and survivors don't know the current meta don't exploit the map very well and don't have those popular perks. The game becomes significantly less fun when the skill level increases. This is because of those reasons previously mentioned. The games become either very short because the killer slaughtered everyone in a matter of minutes or it becomes a giant chase fest for the survivors and the killer starts to wonder who is actually king of the arena. The game would be better if the Devs tried to capture what makes the game fun for the reletively new players. Those moments where no one is trying to use cheap exploits (looking at both sides here) to get an advantange over the other group. The game needs more hiding perks for the survivors and better chase perks for the killers. Survivors should actually be afraid of getting chased and killers should actually have to struggle with finding survivors. The devs need to go back to the basics because I doubt that the game in its current state is what they envisioned.,Dead by Daylight

2016-08-10,3,2,1,False,Not Recommended,"Absolutely horrendous matchmaking is the only real complaint I have about this game. It works the same general way matchmaking in Dark Souls works in that the game spends several seconds searching for a suitable match before automatically quitting and forcing you to ready up again rather than actively searching until you connect with someone doing the same. In other words it is a requirement that another person hits ""Ready"" at the exact moment you do for you to be matched together otherwise the game will stop searching after quite literally 2 seconds.Somewhat recommended if you want to play alone or with TWO other friends as finding suitable matches is much simpler and faster this way due to the fact that solo players are often teamed up instantly with each other or teams of three. However I can't remotely recommended this if you're only here to play with one other friend as finding a suitable match is extremely rare and tedious when you're two teamed players.To conclude in its current state I wouldn't recommend anyone to spend this much money on a MP only game with such a broken matchmaking system.",Dead by Daylight

2018-07-26,0,0,280,False,Recommended,The game is good right now and it is getting better. For the longest time this game has suffered through an inbalance between killers and survivors. Survivors were given too many tools to prevent or prolong the killer catching them. Then in the latest patches survivors have been nerfed to allow the killer to actually kill them. Many games I played I would get in chase after chase after chase being able to down them quickly and do my objective of putting them on a hook but it wasn't enough. Despite my best efforts and doing my objective as fast as possible survivors were able to do their's faster and they all escaped. The new patches aren't even that bad for survivors it's just that certain playstyles they did that were unfair towards the killer are now being looked at and taken out. Killers are being buffed to make the a viable option in the higher ranks and more perks are (survivor and killer) are being buffed to make them also viable in the higher ranks. The only reason this game is mixed is because survivor mains want to win everytime and now that they can't use t mechanics or crutch perks they are losing their rank and complaining that the killer always wins. Do not trust them if you have to wait. The bad reviews will soon go as people realize that it is childish.,Dead by Daylight

2017-11-09,0,0,180,False,Recommended,"Dear Future Dead By Daylight PlayersSo this game is an extreme amount of fun from what I have played of it somtimes. With your friends this game is great. With people online it's a real crapshoot. As a survivor you find hardly any trolls and for the killers that face camp it's only at the lower ranks (I'm considering 20 as low because it has you know lower skilled players) and even then I have not really seen it a whole lot of camping (DISCLAIMER. Big *** difference between face camping and patroling but more on that later) And the other survivors don't often block your esacpe from the killer. It's usally calm and cheery even with killers somtimes with everyone saying gg and good job and all that. BUT.....BIG FREAKING BUTT If you go as killer that's where the toxicity appears suddenly as you are frequented by low ranked veterans who only stay low to troll noob killers. Each match will probably have someone ranting how you were camping. This being you as a killer just standing in front of them not even moving untill they die (but as I said ranks higher than 19 don't do this because it gives the survivors SO MUCH TIME to get generators) but really as smarter killers tend to do you were patrolling around the area of the hooked survivor However the most extruciating thing of all follows this set of patterns. Whenever you go into a new rank with a pip and think to your self ""Well I got nuthin better to do let's see what kind of players are in the next rank"" and then proceed to click to create lobby...... You will get chewed up spit out and pitied trolled and worst of all........................ they still lose thier at you when you ""camp. Even worse the killers all get perks *ahem* they get good perks at first but Devs quickly nerf them down because of the outcry of y trolls and ""Elitists"" who play as survivors. I don't really know wether to recommend or not. It's great with friends with the gentleman's agreement to not use perks or at least not op ones but that is it unless you like reading a book as your charecter fixes a generator and everyone else trolls the killer and you know there is almost no way you can die.AfterthoughtsSo overall dont come into this without friends. It's almost a requirement to practice with them as a killer if you don't want to chuck your computer at the wall in frustration. It's a great game and there are some really chill and friendly people in it but as always the few s who find no other enjoyment in life then sitting behind a screen wasting away to troll others who as they say sit behind a screen and waste away.I hope this was informative and I sincerely hope that my expierience as a killer main was just an unlucky one and not reflective of the expierience of others. Particularly the killers.SignedSome chick with a moustacheP.S.Once again I fervently urge you to buy this game with others or at least know some people who already have it so you can play and have fun as both survivor and killer.",Dead by Daylight

It is definetly fun for both sides and best enjoyed with a full set of friends but alone online is fun too. Here is a +/ list to give you an overview+++ different maps in which the objects are generated at random points ""skill"" trees in which you hunt the most rare and useful perks and offerings Now with party system different killers and survivors let you choose your playstyle intense gameplay balanced. 2016-09-26,0,0,2238,False,Recommended,My first actual horror game never really liked them because scary )Watched a streamer (Admiral Bahroo) playing this game for few months and I really liked the gameplay mechanic and the intense moments. I had some previous experience on pc gaming but as a fairly new player I bought this game on a fair price. I fell in love with the game right away and now maybe month later I have over 200hours of gametime in this game. I ve played equally both killer and survivor and leveling them up pretty equally. I like the rng in bloodweb and getting random items. The combinations of perks and add ons really makes the gameplay interesting and adds a twist in every single game.The game has many qualities like the add ons and perk combination the bloodweb and the selection of killers and survivors. My favorites so far as a killer are hillbilly and wraith (yes you read it right) and for the survivors maybe meg and claudette (obviously). Although the pizza dwight is op in every way.lolFor negative things about the game comes to mind a few things there are few glitches and bugs that makes the game sometimes not so much fun (f.ex the pallet stun where the killer gets stuck in the pallet) the huge grind you have to go through to get some decent perks and possible prestige levels and the somewhat wierd performance issues in certain maps and overall in the game.There is a lot of discussion about the balance between killers and survivors what I have noticed is that as you climb up the ranking ladder the harder the games are. But that s the way it should be the better you get the better opponents you should face. Maybe the only real issue is playing as a killers against a well organized survive with friends team with mic communication. That makes the killing much more challenging although not impossible. I have had multible fun games both high rank and low rank games.Overall I think this game is very enjoyable and exciting at times and if you are looking for a survival game with some grind in to it then this is your game for sure! See ya out there on the fields of horror! D,Dead by Daylight

2016-06-28,0,0,324,False,Not Recommended,"First of all i would like to say that this game is an amazing game for being in beta still! Honestly thats what it is. Rushed out before it was finished like most games nowadays. This game is tons of fun the concept is fantastic and addictive. However the mechanics and proceses that come along with the concept are either broken or lacking. The join lobby is not a queue rather a quick join. With that you get a lot of ""failed to connect"" issues. There is no party system so you cannot play with your friends on a ranked system. You are left with a create a friends only lobby that nets you nothing. A party system was promised on release since it was not in beta as well harking back to why this is still beta.The some perks are broken vague or worded wrong. For example the ""Insidious"" perk says ""unlocks the stealth ability. By standing still for 3 seconds you reduce your terror radius to zero and become stealthy until you act again."" You would think that you would become invisible because the game teaches you that as stealth from the wraith but you do not. it just reduces your terror range to zero despite it leading you to think there are two properties. The survivor perk ""spine Chill"" is completely broken and does nothing. A lot of the skill tree is vague as well. When i fist started playing and getting items some would say ""increases your blood points for Boldness."" What is Boldness??? I had no idea b the game never explains it nor is there a way to look at it in the menus. It just shows quickly at the end of the game.Add on's there are add on's for you to add onto the items you bring. Some are also broken others don't do what the explanation says. There is no punishment for stalling leaving games or dodging a pregame if you think the players are to hard to play against. You can literally wait an troll for Hours in game. For example I got glitched into the floor while opening a chest no reason why it just happened. I couldn't move no one could save me and the killer couldn't hit me. So it became a waiting game of ""who will leave first?"" You can do the same thing at the exit leaving the killer to wander and hope someone massively slips up. If no one does then its whenever they want to end the game. Further more people can disconnect from the game without punishment and further punishing players who want to play. Another personal example is that I was running for the exit and just about to get there and the killer pressed Alt F4 causing the game to end. The game brings you to the victory screen and says ""you escaped"" but you don't get any additional points. You Have to escape using the games mechanics to get those points the killer robbed us of that and didn't get any lesser points then what he was going to get nor a punishment of any kind. On top of that If they do that to you your survivor rank goes down! it's not based on wins its based on points accumulated withing the game. If you are a killer and get into a game where everyone DC's right off the bat you go to the great victory screen and then the bummer you lose a rank screen. The menu UI is not fluid and clunky in places not terrible but a super easy fix and should be perfect for release.In short Even with these looming problems and then some this game is addictive and fantastic. I am still going to play it but keeping in mind that the game is broken and people who break the rules get off scott free while punishing you. If you don't accept that then this game will be a frustrating mess for you. **Update!*The new DLC came out and luckly the game no longer works! Seems like they are scrambeling now just in time for a random free weekend download!******UPDATE!****I main survivor and its hard to keep playing this game when the killers are so underpowered. There really needs to be a rebalance. I shouldnt be able to abuse and man handel a killer by myself.",Dead by Daylight

2016-12-16,0,0,201,False,Recommended,So after reaching sixty hours in this game i thought it might be just the time to write a review about this amazing game!So what is 'Dead By Daylight'?Dead By Daylight is an asymmetrical horror survival game developed by Behavior Interactive and published by Starbreeze Studios. It is basically a 4v1 match in which the killer is trying to kill the survivors and the survivors are trying to escape the given area and of course not getting caught on the killer's hooks.What makes this game really cool is the fresh concept and the many ways you can play the game.Now i'll try to talk about the Survivors and after that we'll talk about the Killers.SurvivorsAs a Survivor you primary objective is to escape which you can accomplish by fixing a number of generators ( the number of generators depend on the number of survivor players ). These generators also require you to pass their 'Skill Checks' which is basically like a QTE. A special sound effect signals that a skill check is coming and then you have to press 'Space' in the given zone to pass the skill check. If you fail a Skill Check the generator's Fix Bar will deprogress and it will generate a loud noise which is shown to the Killer! You can play as several survivors Meg ( not the girl from Family Guy ) Dwight Jake Nea Claudette Ace and finally ( as a guest survivor ) Laurie Strode ( from the superb Halloween Movies ) All of these survivors have different perks attached to them although when you reach a specific level you can buy a 'Teachable' version of that perk in the Bloodweb which can be taught to other survivors. Of course fixing generators aren't the only thing you can do you can also cleanse totems help other players survive or just basically troll the out of the Killer! Own Opinion i love playing as a Survivor its really fun although with friends its even better!KillersAs a killer you have to kill every single survivor. That's all really..xDJokes Aside you can play as several killers including The Trapper The HillBilly The Wraith The Nurse The Hag and the one and only Michael Myers ( The Shape ) I'll do a quick review of these charactersThe Trapper one of the most popular killers he places bear traps around the map which can incapacitate survivors who step into it. Its the first Killer that i played ( and actually prestige'd with ) and he's superb! really fun! The HillBilly Haven't played this Killer but iam planning to! He uses his chainsaw to berzerk around the map and if the chainsaw hits a survivor it instantly incapacitates them! looks like a fun Killer!The Wraith Haven't played this dude. This is the Killer that uses his Bell to go invisible and jumpscare the out of the survivors! He looks like a fun dude so i will definietly give him a shot!The Nurse Haven't played her but i know she is the most difficult Killer to play as! This Killer uses a magical force to 'Blink' around the map! The nurse can be a pain in the if the player can use her! She sounds fun and she needs a lot of practicing! The Hag Haven't played her! The hag is a Killer which is based around the legend known as 'Vendigos'! This Killer can draw traps with her bloody finger which then can be triggered by survivors that go too close giving the Hag the ability to teleport to that trap anytime! She is a really fun killer!Michael Myers ( The Shape ) The most fun Killer in the entire game IMO. He uses 'Stalking' as his ability to Stalk survivors ( just like he did with Laurie in the movie ) to gain Evil Within which give him a lot of bonuses to use againts the Survivors! The Shape is the ultimate killer IMO because he brings a new stragedy into this game which is always appriciated! My Favourite killer ( along with the Trapper )Some Negatives about the game The ing bugs...jesus christ xD the game is almost full of bugs starting from getting stuck in in' trees getting Infinite Loading screens the Killer havin' no body only a head and the Killer's specific weapon! These bugs can be game breaking or just simply annoying. please fix these devs!Exploits..some people like to exploit the bugs of this game..for example i met a player who had a chainsaw on The Shape! Crazy as and its game breaking.Infinites. Although the devs are already working on Pallet Looping ( Sprinting around a pallet until you can do a Killer Stun on the Killer ) it is still worth mentioning since its a piece of tactic and if you actually use it you shall be awarded with a sucker punch into the nuts!The Community ! Despite the fact that i don't really list communities into cons ( and no way iam going to give the game a lower score because of the playerbase ) iam still going to say it for newcomers that most of the playerbase is filled with salty s! Survivors cry because you killed them as a Killer and Killers cry because you pallet looped while you didn't even touch a pallet! Just try to avoid funny conversations like these.Matchmaking ! The game has a ranking system but it really just matches you up with random people! As a Rank Eight Killer i get matched up againsts either a full team of Rank 20s or a full team of Rank 1 Survivors!Now lets get down to the cons and the pros and my final verdict!Pros Fun Fresh and Unique concept! Fun Gameplay Amazing game to play with Friends! Two playstyles! Play as either a survivor or a killer! Michael Myers is absolutely amazing in this game! Good DLCs Devs are patching up bugs and ! Overall just a really great game!Cons Game Breaking and annoying bugs! Most of the Community ( Salty Survivors and Salty Killers ) Infinites( Although bugs and infinites are being worked on by the developers! hopefully they'll find a good solution to these problems! ) Overall i think Dead By Daylight is a new fresh concept and its EASILY worth the full price! I give the game a solid and easy 8/10! 2016-10-26,0,0,42,False,Recommended,"Here's the thing about Dead By Daylight. It's broken as hell and the devs don't seem to know what the hell they're doing half the time.And that's perfectly okay.Dead by Daylight is a very fun game to play solo or otherwise. The pure adrenaline of running away from the killer is something quite extraordinary. Learning all the different ways to juke the killer is something to behold as it will take hours to get right. But once you do it's incredibly satisfying.The current gripe the community has with the game (v1.2.1) is that the new killer Michael Myers is incredibly OP. This is not the case. He came out approximately 15 hours before posting this review and already the community is whining about the new killer. If there's anything to take from that is that the community for this game can sometimes be sub par due to them being really picky about how the game plays and are impatient about learning how to play against a killer who changes the way you play just a bit.Another gripe the community has is that the Halloween DLC makes the game Play to Win. Once again this is not the case. Yes the DLC is $7 and includes a killer and survivor. But that doesn't mean you have to pay to get them. You can unlock the killer and survivor in game but you cannot level them up. Yes it does suck that it's behind a paywall to get any big use out of them but that isn't pay to win it's just inconvinient. Overall Dead by Daylight is an incredibly fun game that can keep you entertained for hours with its ""one more game"" mentality. I highly recommend at least giving it a try regardless of what the community says.",Dead by Daylight

2017-10-23,0,0,1430,False,Not Recommended,First of all what an addicting game. The gameplay is fairly smooth and isn't nearly as buggy as Friday the 13th. The killers are all fairly unique and offer interesting perks to unlock which change the way you'll hunt the survivors. There are enough perks to make your builds unique and interesting. However there are absolutely top tier and bottom tier perks for both survivors and killers.I would recommend this game to anyone who is willing to sacrafice precious hours of sleep. You won't have a choice once you've downloaded it. Do be aware that some of the community members are salty and are frustrated with certain tactics that each side (killer and survivor) have developed. Some of these complaints are valid but they are not excuses for making bad plays and not punishing that of their opponents. Just say gg after your matches and learn as much as you can. Good luck in the fog!*Update*The devs nerfed a DLC killer based on the data from the lowest skilled players in the game at rank 20. Freddy was an interesting killer. His main issue is that he can't attack a survivor until they transition into the dream world. This makes him very weak. They destroyed a really awesome IP and a potentially great killer. The devs don't seem like they are making positive changes or listening to their community. They lost major consumer confidence.,Dead by Daylight

2016-06-16,0,0,1463,False,Recommended,"Actually going to seriously review this game after 2 years of owning it. It's got its bugs its non dedicated servers its toxic community but as you can see from my playtime I always keep coming back to it. Unlike other games that have attempted to move in on the assymmetrical horror game genre that DbD has (ex f13 and the latest DBD clone Soul at Stake) it somehow keeps me coming back to play more and more. It's a lot of fun with friends and even at the moments of bad experiences with other players I've had good ones and made a lot of new friends. A lot of funny ones and terrifying ones (looking at you Pig/Myers). Some of the things that I don't like are the auric cells. I think the cosmetics are super cool and I've managed to get a lot of them from a gift card. Like super cool cosmetics for both survs and killers. I happily support the devs but I feel the prices are too steep. And the ""best"" skins for each character are locked behind these auric cells only. But no lootbox system so there's that. As of the 2.0 update the pallet vacuum was removed making it a bit more fair. But looping (a surv running around a pallet multiple able to bend corners easier because of their smaller hitbox and waste the killer's time) is still a problem. Killers stomp at low ranks and are super weak at high ranks (rip me trying to get to rank 1 killer). SWF is a huge problem and often puts the killer at a huge disadvantage. Put a killer against a 4 man SWF who all know how to loop and have Discord or other Voice chat with all meta perks and the killer is lucky if they get even one kill. On top of this genrushing is a huge issue. Even with the perk Hex Ruin or Hex Huntress Lullaby or any gen slowing perks like Overcharge or Pop Goes the Weasel gens get done most of the time way too quickly. SWF needs a change perhaps a notification for the killer of who is grouped and who is solo. In exchange I don't think the killer should be able to see a surv's profile or information (play time achievements etc). It gives way too much away. Besides those issues and the occuring hilarious bugs/frustrating glitches it really is a fun game at heart and I'd recommend it to anyone.",Dead by Daylight

2018-07-26,0,0,210,False,Recommended,"This game is amazing. From the concept to the game itself. It is thrilling and entertaining by yourself or with friends. I find it to have a very tabletop like mindset where you can sit down and play one game it doesn't have a hundred mechanics so it is easy to grab onto but takes time to master.Unfortunately this game has a very whiny community. As you may have seen since the last patch it got MIXED reviews which is incredibly undeserved. Obviously in a 4 v 1 ranked game the 4 have an advantage in reviews and as a survivor mains I find those negative reviews incredibly undeserved.With mechanics like killers being able to be invisible making it not the standard ""I can see the killer therefore I can avoid him"" it makes for a difficulty spike and forces survivors to adapt their gameplay in scenarios when stealth is nearly almost out of the question... and it seems that new players keep whining about that spike. In any competitive game you will get whining about balance. The situation here is that at higher rank the imbalances shows more and more and the game struggles to please both low rank players and high ranks one. I find myself in the middle playing at the best of my ability to improve challenge the gameplay but never being a tryhard. And the recent killer buffs even if I play survivors 90% of the time are to me extremely fair as an assymetric game should really make the single person very powerful and the remaining 4 only powerful when working together. Although it is not perfect (as no game can really strike a perfect balance) I find the latest patches and latest killer and some to be in the right direction.Really get this game if you want to play with friends or have a good time and squeal as you see the clever af mechanics linked to your favorite slasher killer (rip if it's Jason tho). If you're not sure go watch great youtuber/streamers like tydetyme hybridpanda n00b3... they are high ranks but greatly enjoy the game and watching them just makes you want to try it out.",Dead by Daylight

2017-09-16,0,0,14,False,Not Recommended,This game has potential but like all games that have 'potential' it'll never be what it could be. The killer can outrun you no matter what 100% of the time. In very few games has the killer 'let us win' because he was just messing around &amp 'point farming' I guess.Even though I think some of the 'slashing/disabling' attacks are a bit too much (1 hit for leatherface) to counter this the killer should run at our same speed &amp have an ability to sprint for 6 seconds (to catch up) with a minute cooldown or something similiar. It's like playing a racing game &amp the other guy (AI or not) has a car that's faster than yours. Taking turns closely &amp braking just right doesn't matter after awhile he'll pass you by. 2016-07-31,0,0,2,False,Not Recommended,"My main problem is that the Killer has a massive advantage over the Survivors. There is no way to communicate with your team so you basically have to guess what everyone else is doing whilst the game is happening. I guess this makes it more ""realistic"" or ""immersive"" and I've read that some people prefer it like this since you can choose to be a lone survivor or help the team. There is no point having a team based game if you can't communicate with your team. What's the point of having lobby chat and nothing in the actual game?The Killers are stupidly over powered. If you sprint or bleed they know exactly where you are and it's just a matter of time until they slice you down. If you don't sprint and have no blood coming out then you'll just get caught by the Killer because they can move as fast as you can. Having 3rd person perspective is not an advantage it's just different. I don't see how ""limiting"" the Killer to 1st person is meant to balance it out. Maybe it's just meant to be a quirky mechanic I'm not really sure.There is no information in the game about the Bloodweb/Perks system. Here is my brief experience of trying to level up when I was first in the game ""Hey I can get a torch cool"" *double clicks Torch*""Why didn't that buy?""*2 minutes later*""Oh you have to hold it down. Okay that's fine I've got a torch now""*goes into game with torch loses and goes back to menu*""Hey where did my torch go?""So items are consumable after one game. You have to then unlock them again if you want to use them. Nothing tells you any of this when you're in the menu I just came to the realisation. I know a lot of people will say ""You should have researched before playing this game"" but that's a poor excuse for reasoning. Games are meant to help new players when they start it's not meant to be about being confusing.On top of that the mechanic behind the ""checks"" is ridiculous. Which member of the development team said ""Well you know this games already good you know what would make it better? QUICK TIME EVENTS!"". Yes everyones favourite strain of AIDs Quick Time Events. Make sure you don't have a mechanical keyboard and accidentally press the Space bar too quickly because that generator will blow up every single time. Want to heal your friend? You just made him scream and bleed even more. Quick Time Events are not a test of reflexes and are definitely not any indicators of skill they are a mistake which was born from consoles and Neanderthalic button bashing mechanics like this should have died with the Gamecube.Another thing that aggravated me was the basic tactics that most of the Killers seemed to employ. Out of the handful of games I played it was mostly people picking the Wraith. The main strategy seemed to be something like this Go invisible Find a survivor Get them on the hook Stand next to the hook waiting for them to die Repeat until all survivors are deadThat was literally it. I briefly read some posts on the subreddit about people defending the hook camping strategy but since Reddit suffers from ultimate groupthink syndrome it's pretty easy to see that they are all biased. Of course they think that it's a good strat just put a thinly veiled reason for it and people will say ""Yeah you're right"" for fear of being called out by someone else. I can see how it's fun for the Killer because it's easy points for them. I'm sure someone will tell me ""Hey well that's not actually how it works"" but the fact is that the Survivors are just constantly getting caught and then hook camped to death. It's not fun for me to be the 1st or 2nd person to be killed and then have to Spectate a match where the Killer either does the same thing to the remaining Survivors or the other Survivors escape because the Killer was busy hook camping.I played a few games as each Killer as well to see if I was missing something. I was not missing anything it is easy and I can totally understand why it takes longer to find games where you want to be the Killer. Join as a Survivor and you're right into the game. Want to be the Killer? Good luck waiting 5 minutes for other people to turn up. I'm guessing this is because everyone wants to play as the Killer and the only people who want to play as Survivor are those that have just started playing the game (as they don't know any better) or those who just want to play and don't want to have to wait 5 minutes between each instance.All in all this game is only really good if you've been playing it from the start. All the people that will praise this game are those who have sunk a significant amount of time into gaining perks or just play Killer constantly. I don't have time for a game dominated by fanboys especially when the underlying mechanic behind it is QTE. There is not a stealth element it's not even a scary game.I honestly gave it my best try and I'm over the amount of hours for a refund now so I'm stuck with this game. In an attempt to make lemonade from my salt I will keep a close eye on the updates to this game to see if it gets better. There is great potential here but it's clouded by a select group of people who abuse the game and broken/outdated mechanics like QTEs.EDIT Don't just disagree with my review tell me why you disagree with it. If you look at the recent reviews from this game you'll see that the majority of them are negative reviews from people with many more hours than I have on this game. They are also (mostly) listing the same reasons as I am. Hook camping killers downvote without saying anything.That being said I am still attempting to play this game to see if longevity provides some form of entertainment. I have some hopes that it won't be a complete waste of money.",Dead by Daylight

2016-06-16,1,1,41,False,Recommended,"Edited to account for new patches.TLDR I really like this game the only iffy parts are minor ranking/technical issues. If things like achievements not working occasional animation bugs and some items being unbalanced bother you then wait a little while until they're fixed.Positives The gameplay is fairly well balanced although it may not seem like it when you first start out as some things can only be learned through experience. But at the end of the day you can complete your goals as either a survivor or killer and have a good chance as either. The random generation of map and elements means that both sides need to consider the map layout in their actions. Survivors don't automatically know where the generators are and the killers don't automatically know where survivors are likely to camp items as chest locations change. All the killers have different playstyles and all the survivors specialize in different things. A match where the trapper is the killer will be played differently than a match where the wraith is the killer. A match with 3 lvl 15 jakes will be played differently than a match with all 4 characters. If you screw up as a survivor it is not an immediate game over your friends can save you or you can salvage the situation. This makes it slightly easier on new players.Negatives Gameplay Edition The tutorial teaches the main points and nothing else. While there is only so much strategy a tutorial can teach in a multiplayer game some basic elements like all the uses of items are only stated on the wiki outside of the game and not in the tutorials. Currently the game is geared towards the selfish survivor. You are much more likely to escape if you repair generators while the killer is busy with your friends than if you risk life and limb to save them. Balance issues most of which are minor Any new survivor player will have difficulty if the wraith is the killer on enclosed maps as they won't have the perks to know when he's coming and the enclosed areas mean they can't visually see him. The flashlight is very underpowered and about as effective as it would be in real life. Negatives Tech Edition No queueing with friends (As of 6/16/2016). You can host private games but you and 2 friends can't all queue in a group to get the full number of people. Ranking issues Rank is currently not an indication of skill and there are 2 main categories of players those who rank up indefinately and those who don't care about rank and are continuously at rank 20 even as their characters get more and more skills and perks. (I'm not an amazing player but I have a lot of perks as a crutch and if ranking was alright myself and quite a few others would probably be at rank 15 18 instead of at 20 shredding the poor newbies.) Minor bugs some of which are funny (animation bugs) and some of which are annoying. It is possible for a hatch to be invisible and uninteractive even after the requirements to open it are met. If the trapper places a trap under a hooked player then their teammates can't disarm it because the ""unhook"" prompt takes priority over the ""disarm"" prompt.",Dead by Daylight

As in First and Third person view. Survivors can see around corners thier perception is OTHERWORLDLY. Not to mention ""cone perks"" were it basically feels like they see you coming a mile away cept when u play MM. The hunter is in 1st person view? Good luck at running down fresh survivors who have evaded the entire match. Now taunt you at every moment they get because YOU CAMPED YOU BASTARD! You didnt let our teamate GO FREE! OR OTHER cool tactic they use THEY WILL DC AT THE POINT OF DEATH! Screwing thier whole team over! get you tons of points! meanwhile the survivors whine and Killers are OP! Resolve Ive been a proactive killer using my one single epic' ability. swatting with my oh so awesome doom weapons. pressing spacebar to slowly step over obsticles to pointlessly damage the survivor objective generators and holding the W key alot. To circle endlessly around survivor known"" pallet drop locations This games rough. I cant even fathom the strategy and tactics used. Theres pallets theres hooks..and uh.. w a s d right mouse button left button spacebar..... The enemy team can talk to each other can heal can see you can get out of almost any situation you can think of. The game claims to be scary they are NOT scared of you they are working around you. If there were actual Killer ABILITIES like keyboard keys 1 2 3 4 to vary what your actually going to do and not be predictable. UN predictability is scary. Limiting the survivors perspective view way further down than crystal clear 3rd person mile long see around corners vision. IS SCARY. As a killer you get perks that are terrible meh rating at best moderate this or that. AWESOME! KILL! not. I own all the killers. You have not talked about perks they say. Perks perks perks. That means lvl lvl lvl lvl. Not worth my time. This games not worth dedication. Its Pallets and hooks for hells sake. Bare bones PVP. With an extreem lack of well insane ways to kill spikes! dead fall pits! hanging log traps! I DONT KNOW HAVE WE EVER watched horror movies before we came to this video game design? The Survivors suck to play against the Ledgendary killers are about as scary as a falling pallet. Predictable as well. If theres any real hope for this game needs more traps hell TRAPS FOR EVERYONE! I can come up with 10 000 ideas that could make this game more authentic to its ing Ledgenday Roots. More traps more abilities more killers more survivors more creativity. 2016-06-30,0,0,69,False,Not Recommended,I do not reccomend this game. I will start with the most glareing reasons. I am sad to say this though because I love the concept and really tried to like the game. So to start off with we will do Cons since I don't reccomend the game First Glaringly unplayable due to lots of issues with glitches. I have about 10 friends who play this game of those 10 atleast 3 experince glitches that range from weird and annoying to game breaking. I have videos on my stream of the gamebreaking glitches happening lots of times while I am live. I can go into details but most glitches include character models tripping out or worse broken game client that doesn't work/crashes entirely kicking you from the match.There is a little box that comes up saying when did this happen? I wrote in a few times but quickly gave up and waited a few weeks for a patch. Most might say (oh it's on your end something isn't installed properly but I have done all the appropriate things to make sure the game should have no issues. I have a brand new I5 6600K processor 16 gigs of ram a gtx 980ti etc. etc. You get the point it was proffessionally built and less than 2 months old. No issues with any other game I play and verified intergritty of the files in steam. These glitches happen 1 out of 3 games and leave me relaunching with no points and a loss for the match. Outside of that matchmaking is REALLY REALLY BAD. By this I mean the times are huge considering everyone is playing this game the ranks are so spread out bottom ranks playing agasint top ranked players etc. one or the other would be meh fine. But I have an average of 3 5 minutes at least for queues and then I will have a rank or level that has atleast 10 times as much time in the game as I do. This coupled with the crashing make the game really hard to play in the first place.Those are out of game issues or playability. So how is the game when it is running properyly? It is fun definitely fun. I'd probably change this to a reccomend but not a 10/10 OMG get this reccomendation. as it stands. The game has a fun concept solo tough guy vs 4 weak guys trying to escape. Think mario party but a bit more complicated.With that being said it isn't super duper complicated. The concept is simple and easy enough to figure out after a match or two making the learning curve not too steep. However with perks and items there is enough to keep you invested for quite a while perfecting your master plans. I give it a 100 or 200 play hours before I would find myself bored or craving something new. However I can't do it with all the issues. With that being said 100 hours on a game that's only 20 bucks? totally worth it!!! I think this is a great game that should have had more polish and a cleaner launch. Worst launch ever?? No blizzard holds that record in my book. but blizzard also cleaned up a lot faster this is 2 or 3 weeks out and I still see people having issues no one can solve. All in all do you loovvvveee the concept and you're willing to take the risk? If so buy it. but if you're going to be frustrated by mechanics not being polished random crashes and horrible matchmaking? stay away!!,Dead by Daylight
