2016-07-31,0,0,33,False,Not Recommended,"Product received for free. As everyone's noted the party system doesn't work/exist. But at least it'll eventually go through with Survivors. Making a Killer vs. friend Survivors game can't be done without a full party and awards no points. Besides that the Bloodweb is worthless. Everything except for Perks are single use but also in the way of Perks. Everything in it is mandatory to level up so I hope you like single use overpriced garbage. The Corn level is misery. Utter blindness somewhat detracts from the fun. Balance is pretty mediocre. If the Wraith has any advantage on the Trapper I don't know what it is. (Update He has several late game perks that allow him to functionally wallhack.) Struggling out of a Sacrifice is literally impossible. I decided not to get carpal tunnel and went easier on the space bar and was pretty much instantly killed as soon as I stopped hammering it at max speed. Conversely rescuing a hooked survivor takes half a second and can be brute forced with a second player to bodyblock for you. Survivors only have a few gestures to communicate. No vocal options even pre set. The visual settings cannot be selectively enabled/disabled. Post processing is a huge burden on computers few people seem to want on yet I can't turn it off alone. The lore only found on their website is mediocre and doesn't explain some of the Killers' most interesting features. No map selection.A friend got me this game and is now the only reason I'm tolerating it. This feels like an Early Access game but I know it's never going to be improved because apparently the devs like it with no communication between people intended to cooperate. This suggests that the devs are either amazingly stubborn about their shortcomings or morons.For $5 maybe this game would be worth considering. For $20 buy anything else I haven't also declared hatred for. Wait for Last Year or Friday the 13th to come out. Just don't get this game unless you're a big fan of either wandering around in delecrit fields (and no other environments) or abandoning mute idiot teammates because you're only going to die for trying to help them with a heavy helping of RNG either way to determine how you do.Update I've now played the game for over 11 hours. The devs seem completely unresponsive to the MANY gripes or suggestions about how to fix issues in the game it turns out it was released with known bugs and though my history of party wipes would suggest I no longer suck at the game I still find great fault with it.What I didn't know about the Bloodweb was that at a later level options will disappear from it as some are taken. While this sounds good because I could not spend 5k Bloodpoints (a significant amount) on a single use Offering to take me to a map I hate it also risks destroying the Perk the only significant thing found in every level. Speaking of Perks the ""rarities"" are misnomers. Every time you acquire the same Perk the strength of it goes up. It's Level not Rarity.If the devs REALLY rolled up their sleeves and did some heavy reconstruction the game could still be good but as it is it's mostly a cesspool of cheese and scum tactics with the occasional catharsis of outmaneuvering several players who haven't yet embraced their inner darkness.Update 2018 The community is so toxic that members of it troll the Last Year subreddit and there is now a ton of overpriced gameplay affecting DLC. I recind my suggestion that this game is worth buying for $5. I want a refund and I got it for free. There is clearly never going to be improvement to the terrible core mechanics or hard meta only more overpriced content and the existence of this game is sucking the potential for good horror characters to appear in anything decent. It damages entertainment just by existing. If I could I would review it negatively again.",Dead by Daylight

2017-01-11,0,0,24,False,Recommended,"As of right now (16 hours of gameplay) can I reccomend this game? Yes and No. This game has alot of petential probabley some of the mopst potential of any horor game that has come out in the last few years. Lets start with the pros of the game its a great game to play with friends the graphics are pretty good the controlls are simple but they work and work well. It doesnt take long to find a game but sometimes the connection isint great (see cons) There is also alot of content The Dlc is also very goodNow for the cons of the game. Lets start with the biggest issue bugs the Devs of this game dont seem to care about the bugs as much as the community. As far as survivors it doesnt seem to buggy but playing as the killer is a differant story. As the killer you will notcie the survivors dont move at the same framrate as everything else. You will notcie when you pick up or injur a survivor or watch him jump through a window JUST the survivior will be super laggy and it makes the game feel only halfway finished. As far as the connection you connect to the killers connection and the killer host the games. So if the killers connection is trash so will yours. Another small problem with this game is the fact that come games can get very boring with one of your teammates getting chased the whole game while everyone else gets generators and it doesnt become a survival game it becomes a ""dont miss the skillchecks"" simulator. Conclusion Do i recomend this game? Maybe... if you have friends to play with and dont mind some major bugs sometimes a crappy connection and the occasional boring game then Yes (All these problems could be fixed if the Devs started listening) Will I continue playing this game and buying the DLC? YES! Would I get this game if I had no friends to play it with? Definantly not.",Dead by Daylight

2017-01-30,0,0,367,False,Recommended,4 (survivors) v 1 (killer) gameplay. I believe at this moment there are 11 maps. 6 survivors and 5 killers. Objective as a survivor is to survive the match by repairing a certain amount a generators to power up and escape through the exit gates. As a killer your objective is to kill them all before they escape. Filled with unique perks for survivors and killers alike offerings that affect the maps etc There are also survivor items such as medkits or toolboxes that offer a slight edge against the killer. As well as unique killer abilities like bear traps or invisibility. Invite your friends and strategize together or join a private match and kill them. The current state of the game is nice imo. In the beginning the game was rushed and was released with a lot of bugs balancing issues and a broken matchmaking system. The devs patch the game frequently adding monthly updates that also contain patches/bug fixes and dlc's. There are some issues here and there but overall the game runs great. Its a fun fast paced game that is really enjoyable with friends or even with random's. Its all about survival and teamwork!,Dead by Daylight

A really good killer can wipe out all 4 survs fast and think the killer is cheating not making it too fun for survs happens on new seasons. To all the new players advice is this read up on the game play watch youtube vids read posts and forums or whatever before playing. you are gonna want to catch up on some tactics before you play. noobs agaist noobs probably the most balanced. I love this game no doubt and since I had it for less than a year I've had updates about 10 times. Which means the devs are working on it good or bad but mainly means they are still investing time on it. 2018-10-25,3,1,51,False,Not Recommended,"Games last like 4 5 minutes takes 80 seconds for a survivor to complete 1/5 generators so basically what happens is 3 survivors work on generators while the killer chases around the 4th survivor who probably did about half of his own generator before the chase started. Depending on the survivors skill the chase may last anywhere from 20 40+ seconds if they are a new player or multiple minutes if they are a moderate or above skilled player. The ""chase"" consists of running in circles around garbage piles and dropping garbage pallets in front of the killer while also occasionally jumping through windows. Eventually all 5 generators will be completed and the exit gates opened. Survivors are also armed with tools to make repairing the generators faster tools to blind the killer and make him drop the survivor he just spent 3 minutes chasing and perks that just straight up let a survivor jump off the back of the killer and run away. The big issue is that there is a ""skill cap"" for killers meaning they reach a point where they can no longer ""be better"" the killer has to rely on the survivor making a mistake to finally make a good play and even then survivors have multiple second chances to get out of it.So playing survivor is too easy. You sit and hold left click for 80 seconds on your generator and then help work on the last ones or you run around garbage piles and windows for 3 minutes while your team does the gens. I felt bad FOR THE KILLER alot of games I saw teamates teabagging the killer behind pallets or after flashlight blinding him and making him drop the guy he was chasing for 3 minutes.And playing the killer...well...I would describe it as feeling somewhere in the realm of a 8 year olds hat being thrown back and forth over him between two 16 year old high school bullies while he runs back and forth trying to grab it...yes...that's how it feels to play THE KILLER....When balance issues where brought up to the game director he said ""play something else...try civilization"" they obviously dont care about player feedback.So I cannot recommend this game the concept is awesome...but that's about it. I would recommend walking around this garbage pile...",Dead by Daylight

2016-12-04,0,0,359,False,Not Recommended,"Dead by Daylight is a great idea on paper but in execution it's just not that fun.As someone who loves Horror films I thought the game would be fun and addicting hiding from killers and trying to escape and living out the excitement of Slasher films but instead you're stuck with a janky game that boils down to mashing keys on your keyboard while you wait around for a rescue.Firstly the game's production quality isn't all that great animations look ok enough but the characters movement within the world is choppy and looks bad. There's also no graphical options other than setting details to ""Low/Medium/High/Ultra "" no fine tuning or even setting the resolution. Yes in a game released in 2016 on PC you don't have the option to set the resolution. The game also doesn't perform well with an overclocked GTX 1060 my frame rate dipped well below 50fps every now and then. I can run Battlefield 1 at a constant 60fps with maxed out settings but this somehow struggles. Also load times are terrible probably because the engine is procedurally generating the map everytime. The game doesn't look that great either on Ultra details with muddy textures and poor lighting.Gameplay is where the game really falls flat it rewards high level players giving them the upper hand with unlockable perks while a new player doesn't get anything to pick from there's no starter perks you only get to change how your survivor looks. There's also no tutorials what so ever so when you first jump into it you're left wondering what to do or what the basic mechanics are leaving you to do a lot of guess work. Ranking up requires you to spend points to get perks but as a new player you're not going to arcue many to level up and unlock things thankfully though once you start getting into the swing of things they doll the points out quite generously.Maps are extremely repetitive while they are ""randomized"" they're laid out in such a hap hazard fashion they always feel the same. You get a set of prefabs with different themes (house mansion junkyard) that the world is built out of but it's all the same with different coats of paint. Also nothing is really laid out in a believeable fashion so you don't feel like you're in the ruins of a run down mansion but rather just a field with random brick walls all over the place. Oh and there's hooks all over the place and barrels on fire because reasons. The color of the map lighting also changes but coating the map in orange rather than green doesn't make the maps feel anymore unique. There's (seemingly) only one objective to do as a survivor start up generators and it's already grown tiresome.The killer and surivor relationship is also heavily in favor of the killer but not only that there's nothing to do as a survivor. Your tasks are incredibly basic start up the generators save others hide and escape. You can also knock down cabinets and stuff to slow the killer down but that's it no setting your own traps to slow down the killer or barricading yourself in buildings so this leads to a lot of ring around the rosie with the killer making things more hilarious than tense. Survivor's are slower than the killer and after being hit once you begin to limp causing you to go even slower and easier to get hit again. After being taken down the killer picks you up and you get to mash A/D to... slow him down? Apparently it does something but it really doesn't make a lick of a difference. Once you get placed on a hook you get several chances to escape from the hook (escaping is apparently RNG based?) before you go into a dying state where you mash the hell out of the spacebar to delay you inevitable death and hopefully be saved by another player. Herein lies the rub the killer can literally just sit and watch you die with impunity from other players because there's nothing the survivors can do to disable the killer at all and save you you're basically as good as dead once you're on the hook and the killer just sits there. Once you die that's it quit and find another game or you can spectate the rest of the round but you can't come back it's over. I've had rounds so short that the loading time just to get into the game was longer this is bad game design. Escaping the killer is neigh impossible once they find you it's too easy to continually stalk a survivor and finish them off since the killer always has the upper hand.I'm going to continue playing to see if things change up and I actually start enjoying the game but I doubt it. I hope someone takes this idea but makes a good game out of it because Dead by Daylight is mediocre at best.",Dead by Daylight

2018-07-01,0,0,342,False,Recommended,Horror in games (and films) is too often characterised by jump scares shocking startling events designed to trigger a fight or flight response. Dead by Daylight to its credit eschews these in favour of real horror a gradual increase in tension resulting from the unshakeable sense of impending doom. That it manages to do this in an asymmetrical competitive action game is what is truly impressive about it.Dead by Daylight features two teams four survivors and one killer and pits them against one another in a battle for all the marbles The four survivors need to repair five generators to power the gates which will allow them to escape. The killer needs to find the survivors knock them down put them on hooks and then sacrifice them to their otherworldly gods. The odds are skewed heavily in favour of the invincible killer and as a result playing Dead by Daylight as a survivor can be a nerve rattling sweat inducing terrifying experience.After queuing into a game with three other survivors Dead by Daylight puts you in one of several eerie horror environments a dilapidated farm a run down manor a rickety junkyard and tells you very simply to fix the generators to escape. When you find the generators you then need to repair them a painstakingly slow process where you hold the left mouse button down while crouching in front of it. If you're alone repairing the generator can take more than a minute. As you crouch next to the very noisy generator the game will throw skill tests at you by way of a rotating bar if you fail the QTE the generator will backfire. This creates a noisy explosion and the killer is visually alerted to the location of the backfire turning you into a target.If the killer does find you (and he probably will) your options are limited. If you have a flashlight you can blind him temporarily but your best bet is to run away. The killer moves faster than you can run maintaining the traditional horror movie 'ominous walk' but you can slow him down by leaping through windows or pushing down pallets to block his path. You want to put as many of these obstacles in between the two of you as possible as you flee for your life.Fortunately for the survivors a sixth sense mechanic alerts them to the presence of a nearby killer the closer the killer is the faster your survivor's heart beats. Unfortunately the sound is obscured by generator revving as you repair it. When 90% repaired the generator nearly drowns out the heartbeat entirely forcing you to rely solely on your eyes to see the killer.When you play as the killer you're able to see all the map's generators at all times allowing you to patrol them. If any of them are making noise you know at least one survivor has been working on it and you can hunt for signs that the others are nearby. Panicked survivors will sprint away leaving scratches on nearby walls and breaks in the grass and you can follow these markings to find your prey. Once you find your prey you chop them down pick them up and put them on a hook sacrificing them to your god after 60 seconds.The scoring system initially encourages players to create exciting gameplay opportunities by rewarding risky play. Survivors who engage in lengthy drawn out chases escaping the killer will earn more points for their boldness and you can rack up the points by rescuing other survivors who have been captured but not yet sacrificed. As a killer you're rewarded for killing more of the survivors although a single sacrifice is counted as a victory. Inevitably though this scoring system leads to immersion breaking actions like exploiting the killer's slow movement past obstacles as survivors earn huge points by taunting their hunter.Another problem for Dead by Daylight is its matchmaking system. The game is entirely peer to peer hosted with the killer hosting the survivors at all times. Unfortunately there's no way to tell where in the world the killer is or whether they're capable of hosting five people in a game until you're playing. There's no ping indicator and no regional matchmaking so you have to roll the dice each time you join a new server and if you crap out you'll warp around the game world barely able to work out what's going on. Further there's no group based matchmaking so you can't queue with friends. This results in players lobby hopping until they are grouped with friends which is a terrible experience for all involved.Dead by Daylight executes the concept of a competitive horror game well but only to a point. As players become more familiar with both roles the horror dissipates and they begin to play for the competitive element alone. The poor matchmaking and the highly exploitable scoring system make Dead by Daylight less competitive than it should be resulting in gameplay which doesn't resemble the horror experience it sets out to be.,Dead by Daylight

2016-08-20,0,0,32,False,Recommended,Does this game have problems? yes it does. Does that mean it is not a good game? Absolutely not. This game is a blast to play with friends and is still very exciting to play online with strangers. The game seems to be different every time because the killer runs off of instinct and every player is different causing the in game scenarios to change. While the game is very unrealistic the people playing should understand that this is supposed to be like trying to survive in a horror movie. The game is full of adrenaline rushes and exciting moments. While there are many fun things about this game there are also some negatives as well.Cons Finding a match at weird times of the day can be very difficult. The game runs off of the killer's internet meaning that the survivors have to deal with the killer's crappy connection. Still a little buggy with time that should change though.Definately buy this game if you have friends that are willing to play with you. The experience is significantly better if the survivors are talking to each other. Please don't base your opinion on this game based off of some of the morons who like to sabatoge their team while surviving. The game should get better over time and hopefully they will switch over to dedicated servers. The time I have spent playing this game has come from one free to play weekend alone. I do not think I will pay full price for it but I will definately pick it up when drops below $10.,Dead by Daylight

Give it a go if you like to try out unique experiences and know what you are getting in to you may end up liking it a lot and as far as I know there is nothing else quite like this out there right now. The co op game play can be very satisfying at times. Grabbing people mid action and hanging them on meat hooks is also incredibly satisfying if you're in to that sort of thing and let's not kid ourselves who isn't.As far as an objective recommendation though I'm inclined to steer most people who are on the fence away from this game. Without going in to lots of details and listing where I believe the game could use polish etc I'd say at it's worst it is a frustrating exercise in futility and at best it is a game that manages to have some satisfying mechanics but will ultimately not likely be much fun for most people to play on a moment to moment basis.A horror game where abusing 3rd person camera angle is the core of the gameplay (as survivor)Features exciting gameplay mechanics such as holding m1 for long periods of time while listening for audio cues resisting the urge to hold m1 holding lctrl for long periods of time while listening for audio cues getting interrupted by evil within bomb disarming style mini game at random moments while holding buttons some kind of physical training involving jumping over window sills repeatedly as the killer feel an overwhelming sense of isolation as the survivors ignore you completely while doing these exercises hammering the spacebar for long periods of time to literally not die user friendly controls nothing in this game requires precision only the ability to outsmart idiots and use cheap tactics rare items that change things by 2 and 3% a convoluted ranking system that encourages people to not want to play with each other user friendly configuration options (they are simply left out) character models which you can dress up wooden pallet stompingOK I digress the game really isn't bad and it does have a hell of a lot going for it but it's obviously and unfortunately currently not for me and I urge you to research it before you buy it.I will be going back to check this game out again in a month or so and see what it has to offer at that time because I really wish I enjoyed playing it more than I do and maybe some changes will remedy that for me.,Dead by Daylight

2016-06-27,0,0,45,False,Not Recommended,The game is fun at first...However you will realize that there is only one game type.This is a game of cat and mouse between the killer and the survivors.At first it would seem that killers may have the edge but beware...After small amount of practice survivors will never lose to the killer.The game is full of bull crap mechanics such as 1. INFINITE JUKES! Survivors can literally juke the killer for indefinite amount of time. This is insanely frustrating since as the killer you cannot kill any smart survivors.2. If infinite jukes didn't win you the game then... insane perks for survivors. The killer perks suck while survivors have ones that are game changing.Oh the killer is faster than you? Why not run faster than them for a bit. Oh killer hit you? Just heal up.Oh killer might hook you? Break every hook.Killer is invisible or sneaky? Have a perk that literally detects the killer's presence. 3. If you couldn't win by this time... just disconnect! That's right! As the survivor you have the ultimate ability to escape the killer by disconnecting. There are no downsides infact you are rewarded for this type of behavior.Can you imagine any online game that allowed disconnect to not negatively affect you? Imagine League of Legends Starcraft or CS GO where the disconnector would lose no rank or suffer any consequence. This is what is available.Other than that being from an indie developer the game won't patch anytime soon.The game had potential and has a ton of streamers playing it. However you can quickly tell that streamers can literally troll the killer or the player killer is clearly frustrated by bull mechanics during streams.tl dr You'll have fun for 5 10 hours. If you play killer any decent survivor will never die to you after a bit of practice.To developers Killers need a huge buff.,Dead by Daylight

2018-08-28,0,0,596,False,Not Recommended,This is the ultimate horror game with some famous killers like Freddy Michael Myers etc. As killer you get to chase and kill survivors as survivors you need to do generators then open exit gates or jump through a hatch escape.The issue with the game is current ranking system feels like a custom game from Warcraft3 if the killer has crazy addons and mori or survivors have decisive strike+flashlights then it favors whoever is best at utilizing those. While in most normal high rank games most killers just dodge those lobby's so they can get easier prey's. Some will evetually try facing a group of friends with flashlight but it's usually rough ride. So with easier prey's they can just run them over like how some warcraft3 custom game works they modify whatever map it is to their favor and rockn roll.I'm writing this review after putting about 500hrs into the game and this is my view of the game in current state.The good Great multiplayer horror game. Great graphics and sounds.The bad The killer hosts the game this means he has 0 ping sometimes it lags other it just spikes or rubberband. Terrible idea but it saves them costs for not hosting game servers. There's no compensation or announcement when they have database issues. (This means your progression will not be saved if your in the game or most of the time ur unable to play for many hours.) Very unbalanced I wish there was a competitve mode where survivors have to run around finding items and killers have to find addons. 60hz only we live in 2018 not year 2000. Allthough this game came out in 2016 there is still no update for higher hz monitors which is sad. Gameplay can be repetitive for survivors just do gens run and open exit gates. Bugs there are plenty of them and most of them has to do with perks either being activated or exhaustion perks that just bugs out. Both killer and survivor perks needs balance there are only a few perks everybody uses and the rest are just there for the sake of it nobody would even miss them if they oneday just removed the unused perks.If I knew this was the state of the game since start then I wouldn't have put so many hours into it I would still buy it but just play it once awhile I have to admit that I have all the dlcs and were even planning to buying ingame cosmetics but seeing how the game studio is not upto the task of even trying to balance the game the slighest for the past 6months made me change my mind.,Dead by Daylight

2016-06-16,0,0,30,False,Recommended,"I met this game originally with anger and frustration. I screamed at my pc in angst at the seemingly impossibility to win matches. But then Lord Gaben's voice spoke to me. He said ""Git Gud."" I had a realization maybe this game isn't like other games. Maybe it has different mechanics and must be conquered at a different angle. Maybe the killers seem overpowered because this game isn't Call of Duty and you can't just steamroll your way through. Many will say that this game is buggy or needs more time but honestly it really is not that bad. Sure it definately needs fixing up but that really is no reason to not recommend this game. The game has too much behind it to die. Updates are coming people just need to wait. The game is playable and as many have said even those who would not recommend (riddle me that one batman) it's fun and exciting. The greatest instance was when I was running from the Hillbilly and it was just me. I had 3 more generators or a trapped door. I was in a mad chase. Dodging left and right vaulting over obstacles I still could not lose him. He hit me with that chainsaw and I was immediately downed. Fear and disappointment gripped me as failure was surely lerking by. But then I saw the glimmer of hope before. He knocked me down on the trap door that I was desperately trying to find. My life was saved and I escaped living another day and eluding demonic sacrifice. 10/10 don't let anyone tell you otherwise.",Dead by Daylight

2018-01-27,0,0,705,False,Not Recommended,First off this game at times can be very fun and intense however over time you will come to learn about its many faults and glaring issues as well as the incredibly toxic community.What you're getting with Dead by Daylight is a game that is flawed to its very core design. This leads to a lot of balancing issues and frustrations that may never go away unless the game was redesigned from the ground up. The developers can do their best to alleviate some of these problems but they have always been apart of the game.The only way to play is online in a rank based system where ranks don't matter at all and every month the ranks are reset. You'll see a lot of players even intentionally deranking in order to stomp on new players or because the balance issues are so prevalent in high ranks that it becomes a stressful chore to play.The game director himself has stated that the game was meant to be played without communication among survivors and with a sense of uncertainty but there exists a function in which you can group up with your friends in game and use Discord or some other software to communicate with each other. As you can imagine this creates some big problems for killers and throws the entire design concept out the window giving survivors a very big advantage. There is nothing wrong with wanting to play with friends however the developers have yet to balance the game around this feature and likely never will.I have at least a few more hundred hours in this game on PS4 and I have reached a point in which I cannot recommend this game to somebody in good faith. What is at times a very cool unique and fun experience is more often eclipsed by a multitude of irritating flaws and one of the most toxic and cancerous communities for a game I've seen.,Dead by Daylight

2018-09-03,0,0,227,False,Not Recommended,I like the concept of this game and it can be fun. However as it stands right now the game is unbalanced as hell. There is near as makes no difference no possibility of winning as a survivor.The killers are so beyond overpowered it's not even fun. Especially the dlc killers. The Doctor's ability affects such a large portion of the map at once its ridiculous and it allows him to see where the survivors are at regular intervals. The Nightmare is invisible the entire time so you have no idea where he is and when he's sneaking up on you until it's too late. In addition once you've been pulled into the dream worls he just sees you no matter where you are.However even the base game killers have become op as hell. There are so many killer perks that just show them where the survivors are completely defeating the point of being stealthy. When the killers can cross the map in seconds giving them a wallhack as a perk just means survivors lose every time.Either the killers need to be nerfed or the survivors need to be buffed. The repair times on generators could be lowered also because as it stands right now the killers can circle the entire map 5 times before you fix one. So when you have to stop repairing to hide when the killer comes past for the millionth time the killer sabotages the generator resets your progress and you're left with nothing.I've played over 180 hours as survivor both with friends and randoms and 9 out of 10 games end the same way 4 dead survivors and the killer wins. This game needs some serious balance changes to make it remotely fun to play as a survivor.The devs of this game only care about killer feedback and making the killers more and more overpowered and because the killer mains in the community whine so constantly when even one survivor makes it out we have come to a point where each update nerfs survivors and buffs killers to the point that the game is probably the most one sided game I've ever played.Also this game is plagued by hackers and players using various forms of exploits such as wallhacks to see where survivors are etc. Really makes a game not fun when the killer can see exactly where you are in a game based around stealth.And the devs wonder why there are so few people queing to play survivor (lol) and the wait times for playing killer have grown so long. It's because no one wants to play survivor anymore. It's certainly not fun. If I could get a refund I would.,Dead by Daylight

2016-06-14,0,0,13,False,Recommended,"Dead by Daylight feels like a more horror centered Left 4 Dead. Obvously this means that there is a considerable amount of teamwork invovled but unless you group up with some friends it is going to become very difficult to actually co operate with anyone since there is no in game voice chat. Even if there was no voice chat it would be nice to have some sort of in game callout system where you could call out to your teammates in hopes of linking up with them but risk the monster be able to track you down because of it. The level up system is very ingenous yet simple. Every time you play a mission you collect a certain amount of ""bloodpoints"" (basically XP) depending on how well you perform and what you do. As a survivor healing a wounded teammate or helping them out of a bear trap will award you some extra points whereas as a monster you get point for killing survivors and trapping them. These points are pooled together and you can spend it however you want. There are three monsters and four survivors and they all do something a little different. Leveling up is going to feel similar to a skill tree only instead of a tree it's a web and instead of ONLY get perks and abilities you also get consumable stuff (a flashlight for example) that you may or may not lose when you use it in an online game (games with friends however will not consume these).You can also customize each survivor and killer (I always choose whatever is hardest to see in the dark or tall grass) which adds another layer of personalization. Overall I would definitley recommend picking this up for $30 so far the servers seem a little empty to finding an online game is a little difficult but if you can get 4 or 5 friends into it then this game is going to make a lot of your gaming nights fun.",Dead by Daylight

2016-08-22,0,0,153,False,Not Recommended,"If you don't already own this game I would recommend you to wait. The major change needed for this game is a proper matchmaking system. Right now it has two problems Queueing can take many minutes especially when you want to play with friends. Even then you will experience that the lobby dissolves because the killer disconnects. For me persoanlly more frustrating the way your opponents are chosen is either not working or not very well thought trough. Especially as a new player you will continiously face high level opponents. Dead by Daylight is a grinding game where you will pick up powerful tools to increase the likelyhood of succeding in your objective. Having to face this as a lvl 1 character is plain annoying. I place my hope into the match making change that the devs promised. I recommend you to wait for that and have a look at the perceptions.What else you need to know + game concept ist really fun+ matched are quick (usually around 10min)+ you play against real players who can be very good or not so much+ the survival and hunting aspect really comes to fruition depending whether you play survivor or killer p2p network connection the killer is always the host. This leads to ping/conncetion problems and so called lobby dodging (the killer leaves the match prior to start to look for easier opponents. However the killer might be a new player and this attitude is justified but the survivors will never know and complain about this annoying mechanic) progression is slow in this game. As a late entry you will face fully outfitted opponents and you will suffer because of this. if you want to play with your friends expect long waiting times until you find a killer who is up for the challange the developement team is inexperienced. It feels like every update breaks something else. The last ""DLC"" just introduced dead lobbies which prolong the search for a lobby extensively.At its best this game can be a 8/10. Even though it has limited mechanics it can be really enjoyable.Sometimes it just feels like a broken gameCurrently a 6/10",Dead by Daylight

2018-05-18,0,0,434,False,Recommended,"Overall I like DBD more than I dislike it.The game is still working on balance but it is fun overall.Pros Fun multiplayer options with your friends. You can play with friends as all survivors in survive with friends or play the sandbox mode in kill your friends. In kill your friends everything is unlocked for you but you don't earn any blood points or shards in this mode. There is a lot of variety in the survivors and the killers. You can pick and choose your playstyle which is nice. There are 3 ""teachable"" perks for every survivor and once you get to a high enough level with that survivor if you obtain the teachable perk it will start appearing in other survivors webs. This means you can match your playstyle with other characters with enough time. You can also pick your aesthetic as well to a limited degree. As described above each survivor has their own set of unique perks that can become teachable later on so you can get your favorite perks on your favorite survivor. The outfits are also kind of nice. You can purchase some but also get them through prestiging (when you hit level 50 you can keep unlocking new bloodwebs for new items/offerings/perks OR you can prestige and reset a survivor to level 1 and open up new outfits and also increase the chances of getting better items/offerings/perks on that prestiged survivor's bloodweb) There is a thing called the shrine and with enough shards (a currency you earn by playing the game) you can buy perks before unlocking them on each survivor's web. This is just a time shortcut so that you don't have to play the game for ages before getting your ideal combination of perks and looks.Cons Balance issues. Certain combinations of perks items and offerings are really overpowered.",Dead by Daylight

2016-06-19,0,0,506,False,Recommended,"I've read some bad reviews ones constructive and others putting the game to ET's game level.I'm personally enjoying this game so far. Ok party queues that sometimes take eternities or that simply disconnect the players. Mechanics are simple and at some times a little clupmsy. But still in my experience this is a very innovative game with it's psycho hide and seek gameplay giving you the chance to be either a survivor or the killer both with perks and usable items.The sound plays a huge role in this game because it alerts you of the killer nearness or if a ""skill check"" is about to appear all summed up with heartbeats and accelerating music when you're running for your petty life or moaning from nearby scared and injured players.Should you buy it? Totally. It'll have your heart pounding out of your chest with the thrill and excitement or grinning like a maniac if you decide to be the executioner.Even if you end up not liking it you can come up with a decision within a few matches and ask for a refund just in time. (Which I really doubt because this shet is so addictive it'll have you ""hooked up"" the whole time)",Dead by Daylight

2016-12-17,0,0,196,False,Not Recommended,"Product received for free. I'm struggling to even write this off as a negative or a positive like many before me wish there was a neutral position... But i have to give this game a no. Cause when half the game is playable it defeats the playablity factor cause lets face it its much easier being the killer cause connecting to people is glitchy and downright disgusting. Your either perpetually stuck loading or it fails to connect and its just downright frustrating to experience this I just can't play the survivors for the life of me.Edit Strangely enough the thing thats plagueing this game seemed to have vanished today I have no problems connecting as a survivor. With this out of the way i could say this game is a yes however.... I bet tonight it would be the samething and im not ready to change this to a yes.Final edit Well its come to an end of the free to play weekend and I have to say this game is awesome! For some reason when I first tried this game i had problems connecting as the survivor. I would get stuck on loading screens or fail to connect to the game. And then the next day those things that plague this game had just vanished... I when that happened i was excited to say ""Yes!"" This is an awesome game however... the game can get repetitive the only two things you as the survivor can do is run hide knock pallets down shine a flash light into the killers eyes and finally escape by activating the required generators. But its even less for the killer its chase chase chase whack chase whack and hook them on a device that sacrifices the survivor. Sure each killer has a cool ability that seperates them from the other killers. Its just that the rest of the game is placed on a tread of the same things repeatdly no other gamemodes no additional powers that they could unlock. Survivors stuck with not much to slow the killer down with its just boils down to a crazy frenzy of cat and mouse and there is only so much this formula can do before you realise its boring.Correction Edit I'm still keeping this game a no but i finally gave in and bought the game its just it took time to understand and when i did it was beautiful. I have ton of fun playing as killer and the chase is actually vigorating to the point that you just get that glow of ""I got em!"" also viewing this game through a lens of ""try to have fun ignore what toxic people say and kill some peeps!"". I will give this game a recommendation if they switch to dedicated instead of p2p cause that is one thing that would make this game perfect for me.ps. I know balance issues and all but I just want to have fun stomping people or just outright chase them to feel the good whack sound of hitting my prey.",Dead by Daylight

2017-12-31,0,0,28,False,Recommended,"Dead By Daylight Brings the Horror Genre of Gaming to the Multiplayer Platform. Putting you in a 4 against 1 playstyle as you look around the Maps for Generators to start up and escape from the killers Grasp. I will say some of the enviorments look pretty scary for some people and look interesting for the most part.Each Survivor is exactly the same though so don't worry about picking a survivor over another.all the playstyles are blank pages for you to choose what they are good at.PROS 1.Spooky Atmosphere that will definately keep you on your toes even when the killers notifications are present (Heart Beat) You're constantly looking behind your back when you hear a heart beat cause you know.. the killer is out there and you may be the next unfortunate one to run into the killer before its too late.2.All Killers have different Abilities Whether you're the Shape The Nightmare The Trapper. Each killer has there own unique abilities so it gives them there own benefits and disadvantages. and that keeps players wondering whos the next killer they have to face against.3.The Bloodline system is free to use and you don't have to spend money on getting blood points just play a game and you'll rack them up really easy and its good for reaching Prestige and unlocking perks to give your survivor.The CONS.... Oh boy theres quite a few I wanna nail on.1.NO VOICE CHAT at all... For a game in 2016 there should be voice chat for a game regardless if its a horror game and the devs wanna ""Make the game more scary"" if you're gonna do that then people are just gonna go to Skype Discord etc. since they will fight your system.2.Camping Killers I dunno how many times I've had this happen where my team actually wants to help me or even I wanna help another player and Killers stay in the same spot until the survivor is officially dead. like Why? Why do that you completely kill the game that way.Along with the BodyBlocking is also a pain to deal with I can never move thanks to survivors do ing that.3.Some Survivor Perks are too OP for killers I can get by Decisive Strikes Borrowed Time and many other perks that you can gain but every player I heard uses them and some survivors make fun of the killer for even trying. I think its upsetting how players are using the emotes to make fun of the killer in a way but hey its my opinion.But I will say cause I'm not complaining too much this game is still alot more fun then getting called for work on your day off.My overall review I still think maybe this game should be 15$ instead of 20$ but that's just my opinion. Graphics gets a 7Sound gets a 8and Gameplay gets a 6 7.6/10 Still recommend it.. though with Friends only",Dead by Daylight

2017-09-17,0,0,34,False,Not Recommended,"TLDR at top to save time TLDR Fun but hard to recommend due to progresion system and no match making to find players your rank and get paired up with perked up killers instead a lot of fun with a group of buds though.Progression system is single handedly the worst thing I've experienced in my life 'specially since theres zero semblance of match making for ranks. I'm no stranger to grinding for progress but the way they handled it in this game is something else instead of letting you choose perks and having all slots available to ""build"" a character you have this web of actual trash. They limit you to the amount of perks you can use by level. Once you reach level 25 you can use 4 slots which is fantastic but getting there is slow and painful considering you need to essentially buy trash upgrade items for picks ups. Theres also this ""Cross Class"" type deal where you get what might as well be 0 blood gems per game and you can spend your 0 gems on actual usefull things. (Note I have yet to be able to purchase one of these 360/550 gems)If there was some form of match making system all to pair you up with same leveled people these problems could posisbly be solved because you could actually win games instead of getting destroyed by fully perked out tier 3 killers while all you have is tier 1 ""you actually get nothing beneficial"" perk. All that said it's fun but not very well polished but it's hilariously fun with a group of friends.",Dead by Daylight

2018-05-25,0,0,91,False,Not Recommended,"This game needs two things to happen which will fix the problems that everyone is having objectively in the game. First you need to calm down with the dlc operators and issue a nerf to several of the over done releases...*cough*cough ""Doctor"". There are several other characters that I feel are in good need of NERFS with very few who need minor buffs *cough *cough ""Wraith"". Second you need to address the constant looping that is allowed for the survivors with very little that the killer can do about it but run away and have done nothing but waste their time. I think there needs to be a change that can allow for the killer to pursue looping survivors at an increasing rate where the longer the chase goes the faster and faster the killer gets. This will bode well to enforcing the idea that the survivors should have to work together in order to loop successfully and not just outrun the killer with a single survivor who cana abuse unbalanced and poorly placed windows/pallets without any lashback.... and then you wonder why killers become toxic....thus escalating the cycle of madness that is creating all the toxicity and is killing the game. The devs need to do some balancing or else this game is going to lose the essence of what it once was and still could be.",Dead by Daylight

2016-12-05,0,0,1130,False,Recommended,Positive aspects Each game session called a trial is very thrilling and challenging as a survivor. You are hardly ever left knowing what will happen. The game encourages a strong show of cooperative action amongst the survivors if they are to escape. For killers you feel you are in total control of the match most time (if you know what you are doing). It's not just about killing but doing so with style. Playing as both survivor and killer offer countless options and hours of fun.Negative aspects It has repetitive gameplay as there is only one objective each for the killer and survivors. This is however slightly off set by the various perks maps items and unique killer abilities. There is no in game voice or text chat with the exception of pre game lobby chat (for survivors use and view only). There are also seemingly always bugs they'll patch one and two more will be spawned. 'Camping' killers are still a very bad issue in this game and the developers have not done anything meaningful to dissuade this. (Sure they've added Borrowed Time and the ability to unhook a survivor from any angle but neither of those will get you far if the killer is truly camping.)The game build is currently killer sided so just be warned of that if you are looking to play survivor. There has been a slew of very powerful killers released as well with little to no way of countering their abilities/perks.,Dead by Daylight

2016-09-09,0,0,763,False,Recommended,"Having spent much time in this game I guess it's time for a review.First of all I'd like to say that even thought this game had some problems which persist although dwindling Dead by Daylight is a jewel of 1v4 horror.It executed the atmosphere perfectly and the variety of killers and survivors brings even more depth to the game as well as the randomized stages.Every single session is unique and affected not only by the player controlled killer's abilities and overall experience but also on the teamwork (if players choose to help eachother or go for the ""every man for himself thing"") the player controlled survivors and the variety of their abilities.The devs proved that they wish to add more to this game and not by any means take advantage of the same p2p or p2w system implemented by other games. Since its starting price was the only price I paid and the DLC was absolutely free.For a game worth 20eu it is absolutely great what the devs managed to do and even after +100hs in I still love to continue playing it.The only reasons I can't give this game a 10/10 is because of the horrible matchmaking which I sincerely hope is something in the process of perfecting since it is either a ready simulator or a ""failed to find a game"" often appearing text.Still the execution and the whole idea is extremely well done and I not only recommend buying it as a sale but for its full price!Overall 8/10!!! Great work devs!!!",Dead by Daylight

2017-04-30,0,0,360,False,Not Recommended,"I'm inbetween but i put noI have 254.5 hours on the game currently with all the fun memories of me and my friends playing either kill your friendsor using the ""Quick Match"" Exploit too join the same game and play competitively The first killer (trapper) was a fun experience all around Then Hillbilly came along which added a bit of hype too the game with the killer charging towards you. Then the Wraith came along him being able too cloak added a sort of game mechanic where you had too be hidden and sneak around so he couldn't find you.Then The Nurse came along she was able too teleport and through walls. This made it very easy for the killer too see a generator blow up teleport and slice. since the cooldown is literally on 1 2 seconds this made it insanely easy for the killers too put us on hooks.They never fixed how The Nurse was so unbelievably OP I know nurse mains are gonna compalin about this comment but you nurse mainsEither way back too the review. Sometime later on Micheal Myers appeared he appeared for a halloween type aspect of the game he was fun too play win seeing that his Killer radius was majorly decreased and as he stalked more and more it got bigger (especially at level 3) He could be Op at times as well. There was a feature where if you lost someone and you found them again you would increase in speed for a short period of time. The killer would just circle around stuff and lose sight. then come right back and gain a ton of speed and bring us down in one hit. This wasn't nearly as OP as the nurse but still pretty badOh boy Here comes ""The Crawler"" similar too ""The Trapper"" She places traps in the ground and can be REALLY hard too see the only way too get rid of them is by shining a flash light on them and if you don't have a flash light you have too be ing cautious as all hell I feel like they should have made it too were you can smear the drawing in the ground so it doesn't work. The crawler could teleport (similar too nurse) too a trap if it were activated by a survivor and could only teleport if near. but a perk (and offering) made it a larger distance and together made it a VERY far distance. so it was easy too teleport slice slice hook. REPEATSide notes The game started out awesome the servers WORKED survive with friends is a ing miracle if it works. the only thing i see useful in the game anymore is selecting your own ing map in Kill your friendsreally guys step up your i waited so long too get this game when i heard it was coming out. and then it turned into this? read the reviews and FIX YOUR GAME",Dead by Daylight

2017-09-20,0,0,48,False,Not Recommended,"I was looking forward to this game for a long time. Starting out if you want to play a survivor you're screwed. Maybe once you get perks at higher levels its easy for survivors but at least at lower levels survivors have no chance. Most things you do alert the killer to your location. Running from them leaves a trail. If a killer sees you. You're dead. They will walk you down even if you're running. Skill checks on repairing healing anything...if you fail them they get notified of your location. The skill checks lag like hell. You have to hopefully hit the space bar way before the skill check is in its success area and hope you get it right. Im glad didnt buy this game outright and waited for the humble bundle sale i got it from. at least i got a few other games from it that werent trash. 2016-10-27,0,0,198,False,Recommended,Is this game rough around the edges? YesDoes it take some time to get in to properly? KindaThen why do I recommend it? This is one of the most original games I've ever played. A seriously tense game of cat and mouse between four survivors who can opt to work as a team but ultimately are in it for themselves versus a killer who is out to terrify and kill all four survivors. The genius bit comes into when you are scored (The bloodpoint system). Rather than killing all four survivors as quickly as possible... you're encouraged to make it dramatic. As a killer you can easily just slash a survivor place him on a hook (which is required to kill him) and just watch him die so noone can come to save him but that doesn't score you well. Instead look towards playing with your food and making sure they are tense. It'll work out better trust me.As I say if you want to be a killer try them all and find which one you enjoy most... get into the concept of making yourself a true menace to the survivors without just killing them as fast as possible. If you want to be a survivor work with people but be sure to keep yourself alive for the mostpart. Make sure generators are getting repaired to escape but always make sure you are safe in the meantime and if escape is an option but a friend is on a hook weigh up the option... there isn't always a definitive answer...And whatever you do don't let Michael just stare at you.,Dead by Daylight

2017-07-17,0,0,157,False,Recommended,"I main a survivor my opinion may be different than a killer main. I prefer being hunted and being terrified of the killer.I absolutely love this game. It is one of the best multiplay horror games on the market. This is often compared to f13 and DbD is SO much better. The devs aren't complete to people they actually change the game and update it often. The DLCs are cool but not needed they add good survivors as well as good characters. I just recently began to play as a killer and it is kind of enjoyable but I can't play more than 3 games in a row as the killer. The amount of customizations available makes the game's replayability very high. Michael Myers is by FAR the scariest killer to go up against. Furthermore the ranking system is EXTREMELY balanced (unless it is the 13th of a month if so play as a killer and grind the noobs.) There are constant events and every 3 or 4 months a new DLC is released so far 2 have been free 3 have been payed for. For the game each survivor has 3 unique perks once a certain level you unlock teachable perks which allow for other characters to get those perks in their bloodweb. I as of writing this have about 40 hours 37 of which are survivor 3 are killer. I have one level 45 character that is Claudette she has the ability of self heal which is INCREDIBLY useful. I when I started used Jake because I didn't know ANYTHING about perks (BIG MISTAKE JAKE IS USELESS LATER ON) I recently began playing as William ""Bill"" Overbeck this was as a daily but I actually like him as his ability ""Borrowed Time"" which means that if you unhook someone and the killer hits you or the person that was hooked they go into a ""dying state"" which lasts for a certain amount of time (depending on the level of the perk) and once that time runs out you become downed. Claudette Dwight Will and David are the best free survivors. Nurse and Hillbilly are end game killers. DISCLAIMER IF YOU WANT TO PLAY AGAINST A KILLER IN A DLC YOU DO NOT NEED TO OWN THE DLC! THE PURCHASE ALLOWS YOU TO PLAY AS THAT KILLER If you don't want them all the top two are Spark of Madness and The HALLOWEEN Chapter. Michael Myers is a GREAT killer while repairing a generator and him standing there looking at you and you don't realise it until you turn your camera is HORRIFYING. I jumped out of my chair when I saw that. The Doctor is also terrifying to go against hearing his heartbeat and dreading the treatment attack which would reveal your position adds a whole new element. The survivors are mediocre Laurie has a good perk where she can hit the killer to break free of his grasp.For 20$ it is COMPLETELY worth it. For the 10$ current price tag (as of 9/13 9/18) it is a STEAL! It is easily replayable better with friends but 40 hours solo is pretty fun. If you have 20$ while it is on sale get the DLC. This game is a solid 9/10 it would be a 10/10 if I friends to play it with but I don't.",Dead by Daylight

2018-02-13,0,0,135,False,Not Recommended,"When playing the killer is more stressful than playing a survivor you know there is something fundamentally wrong. If all you want is an adrenaline rush the game might be worth the money. Otherwise stay away even if the game is on sale you should strongly consider if you want to participate in this salty excuse of a horror game. I myself am done with this one I'd say it was fun while it lasted but that would be a lie. Killer If you're looking for a power fantasy playing an unstoppable serial killer terrorizing the 4 survivors. Stay away this game will not provide that experience in it's current state. If you're instead looking to experience the joys of overly altruistic survivors running circles around you as you carry one of their downed friends. If you're looking to experience the joys of chasing survivors in an infinite loop as they take their sweet time teabagging self healing spamming their flashlights emoting etc. after every single pallet and/or window. If you're looking experience the satisfaction of finally catching someone only to then have them decisive strike out of your grip be saved with borrowed time immediately after or just be bodyblocked into oblivion. If you're looking for a game where you yourself have no direct control over whether you win or lose and insted have to rely on others to make a mistake first. Then this is the game for you and I salute you for you can find enjoyment in something I can only find pure unbridled frustration in. Survivor The game is advertised as a horror game and it's certainly provide yo uthat experience at least in the beginning when you're still learning the ropes. And maybe just maybe later as well if you're able to fully immerse yourself in the game. Otherwise the ""horror"" will quickly wear off as you realize that the survivors are the ones that hold all the power over how a match will go. And even if you manage to immerse yourself whatever immersion you managed to achieve will quickly shatter as you watch the other survivors borderline bully the killer into submission.",Dead by Daylight

2016-07-26,0,0,1,False,Not Recommended,"Not a huge fan of this game. Game is not incredibly fun to play alone. Unless you have a set of 4 friends plus yourself to play with you may find this game is considerably less enjoyable. If you do have a group of 5 including yourself you may still have a problem with the game. The posted recommended specs are inaccurate. Typically the recommend specs are specs that allow you to play the game on non minumum settings and not experience any skipping or framerate loss. The computer I used to play this game met or exceeded the recommended specs and still experienced a low framerate at medium settings. Therefore I had to drop them to minimum settings only to experience the exact same framerate despite the settings change Very difficult to play under such poor conditions. Tutorial is very bare bones and not in depth. The tutorial will tell you how to play each 'hunter' or 'hunted'. It will tell you each skill they each have etc. However the skill web and the itemization functions are not explained well at all. I added several ""items"" and ""add ons"" to my hunter to find them missing immediately after a match and since no tutorial expalined how they work I was forced to search the internet to find out that those two portions of the loadout are consumable. 2016-11-25,0,0,54,False,Recommended,"Five people enter Four lucky survivor and one godforsaken creature.The survivors either leave with casualties or don't leave at all.The game plays like a 4v1 game of ""hide and seek"" while various hunters themed after horror movies (one of them is from one) are out to find you cut you up and hang you up for their eldritch deity to snack on you.The survivors have to repair a select amount of generators to power up the escape doors and hopefully escape. All the killers have to do is paint the town red. Most of the game's tension comes from eluding the killer through sneaking and cunning since survivors have no weapons to defend themselves with.The game has some latency issues that are really noticable if you play a game with a killer who has a bad connection.The game also features a perk system to allow both survivors and killers to become more efficient in their select specialities. You get points for it by doing your job as a survivor or killer helping survivors in need or saving them from hooks stunning the killer by knocking an obstacle in his ugly mug or pointing a flashlight at him etc.The game has a bit of grinding involved to get the lovely perks the characters have to offer but the challenges that you are offered on a daily basis really help speed things up so it doesn't turn into the equivalent of your everyday MMO.",Dead by Daylight

2018-05-07,0,0,1125,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight is a flawed gem of a game. Of all the games that have attempted an asymmetrical multiplayer horror survival game Dead by Daylight has by far been the most successful. Pitting a killer against 4 unarmed survivors the game is essentially a slasher film in game form. After a few hours most players will have become numb to the theme revealing the true nature of the game cat and mouse.Now this isn't a bad thing. Cat and mouse is a tried and true formula that few digital games have attempted. In this metric the game is legitimately good although also deeply flawed. The issue arises from the game from when players understand the game well enough to take advantage of level geometry. Rather than trying to hide from the cat the most efficient strategies involve running around certain objects taking advantage of the faster turning radius of the survivor versus killer in order to vastly extend chase time. Combined with a variety of killers that simply ignore stealth the game simply emphasizes chases far more than hiding to the point that high level play gets very samey.Nonetheless the game is still fairly enjoyable given that its primary competitors are far less engaging.,Dead by Daylight

So I managed to get my hands on this game today because of the current trial going on and to be honest now was a good time to try out Dead By Daylight and see how it feels.For the pros I do think it's nice to play matches with friends and you have a small handful of characters and killers to play through which is pretty good. The tutorials were straightforward although frustrating with the skill checks and helped get the feel of the game. I haven't been playing many matches but I will say that in the time I've played maybe its because I'm new to this but the game seems to favor the killer winning. Or maybe a smart killer is paired with new players I do not know.At this point playing survivor is messy. The killers are overpowered and even if the team cooperates it ends terribly because the killers are too overpowered. I don't think its bad to save your team mates or have the bloody trails or the two hits rule I mean you can still struggle and heal teammates but on the survivor side things take way too long. The skill checks and long wait times to boot up the generators and heal your friends are disadvantages and like I mentioned it's not bad to have the game balanced. However these current balances just don't work. While wait times are reasonable ideas for the generators and health packs and searching it's just too long and skill checks make it agonizing. So far it's been impossible to win a single game because the killers are just either really smart or overpowered. Unfortunately I don't think I'd spend any money on this in its current state so I'll utilize this trial while I can before uninstalling after the trial ends.,Dead by Daylight

2018-09-08,0,0,606,False,Recommended,"The Game Itself Dead By Daylight Is an asymmetrical 4v1 horror game.You can take the role as survivor or killer whichever you prefer.Your objective as the survivor is to complete 5 generators then once those are completed you can open the door and wait at the exit doing butt dances! But on a serious note you are challenged to complete 5 generators while facing off a brutal killer. You and your team will need to strategize on how to win. Once all generators are completed you can open one of two gates which then you can escape. If you are caught you are usually put on a hook unless you wiggle free or have decisive strike. you can be hooked two times before you are removed from the round permanently. first time being hooked you can try to free yourself which usually doesn't work or wait for your team to save you. Once you are hooked for the second time or have not been rescued in stage 1 you start stage 2 which you have to repetitively start to spam space. If your team dies and your team has done two generators you can have a chance at finding hatch it pretty often a standoff happens which is pretty dumb in my opinion.Your objective as the killer is to kill all 4 survivors and stop them from getting the gens done. You do not need to kill all survivors to win. It is sorted in a bunch of categories which then determines if you win or not.This all I have to say about the killer as I don't really know what to go into detail about. This may be changed at a later stage. Pros 1. playing as a survivor feels like a rush and the constant suspense will keep you on your toes playing as the killer is super fun and the thrill of the hunt is exhilarating2. Great concept executed at a fair rate.3. mediocre character progression for both the killer and the survivors with various tools add ons perks that can help them accomplish their tasks4. the atmosphere combined with the ambiance and music does a really good job of creating a tense environment5. the audio is done well and you can hear the cries and screams of the survivors as well as other audio cues to help locate your victims6. each map is procedurally generated so you can t just memorize the layouts so each game feels fresh7. the gameplay is very fun and addicting you'll often find yourself wanting to play ""just one more game""8. controller support was added and keybindings are also customizable9. survive with friends mode was added and friends can play together in smaller groups10. the shrine that rotates in teachable perks rewards your time playing and helps reduce the need to grind and level up each survivor. Cons 1. some minor texture bugs and a couple weird graphical glitches where survivors were looked like they were flopping through the air and some of the bodies on hooks but weren t hooked correctly (I'm surprised that some of these still aren't fixed)2. there was also one time where I was unable to heal another player and one other time that I wasn t able to pull the player off of the meat hook because the prompt to do so never came up UPDATED (while this is very rare it can still happen)3. some killers AFK macro hoping to get points and some survivors disconnect making the matches unbalanced4. killers with bad ping will cause survivors to lag into the walls and make them easier to kill (they have added a way to see each other's ping although it is very inaccurate.) I feel like being a killer is significantly easier than being a survivor because you are only relying on yourself not to suck. I ve seen a lot of survivors who are new or sometimes just not very good and it can be a real detriment to the rest of the team and it makes it a lot harder on the rest of the survivors to succeed.Some people might say it s easier for the survivors and in some very rare cases I managed to get a group of competent survivors and the killer never managed to kill everyone. But I feel like in those games the killer was probably just new since those flawless games were few and far between.Every game felt a bit different but admittedly some games were more enjoyable than others depending on how good the other players were. Conclusion I have really enjoyed the game so far but it does have some issues that make it not quite as enjoyable as it could be. Nonetheless I still found myself saying after every game just one more game... It s been a fun game so far but I expect it would be a lot more fun playing with friends it s a great concept and it s got a lot of potential but it would certainly benefit from some small changes here and there.If you have enjoyed the review feel free to add me and tell me your opinions or tell me in the comments below.",Dead by Daylight

2016-08-05,0,0,176,False,Recommended,"The only issues in this game right now are 1) Waiting times for survivors is unreal. Less people are playing Killers (for stupid reasons I'll debunk below).2) There are still issues with Killer Bots who are just scripted to stand in place and keep swinging their weapon. Sure it's free and easy blood points but it ruins the point of the game.3) Human's online are just stupid. Like literally why would you start to heal me when the killer is coming at us?! (Please add a feature where we can shake off other survivors and run. Just make it a noise trigger for the killer to see). Debunking some of the bad reviews ""The game favors surivors and playing killer is just a joke now! You can't win!""&gt &gt &gt This is nonsense. This is literally just a cry from people who aren't as good of a killer as they think they are. Put on the right perks to make finding and handling survivors easier. Be more creative and strategic with the way you chase and capture. Think ahead. I've honestly had NO trouble as the killer and I very rarely play the killer! ""The survivors perks are over powered compared to the killers!""&gt &gt &gt To a small extent I would agree but not enough to where killing all of the survivors is hard by any means. Self Heal Stay on their tracks and they wont have time for it. Sabatour Can be a massive issue but at the pre game screen you can SEE how many survivors might have this perk (or a toolbox). Adjust your perks so that once you catch them you can take them to where YOU want to hang them (i.e. The Basement where they CAN'T undo hooks). And be more aggressive and relentless towards Jake's when you spot them. ""Survivors aren't afraid of the killer anymore! They just toy with him and win!""&gt &gt &gt Again nonsense. It's true there are survivors who try to 'Toy' with the killer by body blocking instantly unhooking people while you're finishing your hooking animation acting as a decoy etc. But those survivors are the easiest to catch! They literally bring themselves TO YOU!Body Blocking Hit them while carrying your victim. It's not hard. It will get them out of your way. Duh.Instant Unhooking You have plenty of time to either 1) Hit the survivor they just took off the hook (and they'll sacrifice faster once you place them back on! GASP!) or 2) Get a hit on the cocky survivor. Chase either one of them down and put them on the hook. They can only use that tactic like 2 times before they're instantly sacrificed when hooked. Decoy They've PRESENTED themself to you. Accept the offering. If they're avoiding you in a troublesome area leave them and search for the others. You'll either 1) Find a new survivor in a more favorable place for you. or 2) The decoy will follow you and likely be in a place more favorable for you. Just because someone's present before you doesn't mean they're the one you HAVE to go after right at that moment. Think and stop being so simple minded. ""The dev's don't listen to the community!""&gt &gt &gt Most of the things you're crying about are personal 'Can't think for myself' problems. You have the solution to most problems as the killer. Adjust your perks and add ons at the pre game screen think outside your simple 'Follow and Hit' methods and put in actual effort. It's not hard catching survivors.",Dead by Daylight

2018-03-19,0,0,150,False,Recommended,I have game for about a year now and honestly it's a game! Yes it has some things that need to be worked on such as new gamemodes like hide and seek more objectives etc. but every game has it's downs. Despite these downs the gameplay is fun addictive sadistic and rewarding. You can play as survivor and either help your fellow teammates to survive or play as a survivor who is a lone wolf and use others as bait. Alternatively you can be the killer and live out your goriest nightmares with you behind the mask. Being killer is a lot harder than being survivor nowadays but it is still a fun experience. Especially when you get that sweet revenge on the survivor who's been trolling you the entire game. This game is not pay to win at all because if you buy DLC characters you just get the chance to use bloodpoints to get new perks where if you don't buy DLC you can still get said perks using in game currency. Speaking of DLC most of the characters are non DLC and are part of an ever expanding roster of killers and survivors. Long story short this game is worth the purchase.,Dead by Daylight

2017-12-26,0,0,460,False,Not Recommended,"PROS Fun game if you play with friends has a ""perk"" system so you can make your own builds and has several popular characters from various franchises. Michael Myers Krueger and a few others. Hackers. This is a fun game only if you don't mind hackers and ragey ignoramus. I bought the game and found that after 8 hours of playing it was fun. Almost all of the time I played were night time hours. I play in the morning and for 2 hours straight I encounter hacker after hacker after hacker. Instantly knowing where I was despite me literally being silent. I can understand if it's a ""perk"" or something gameplay related but after googling the mechanics and checking the other players' perks there was no explanation as to why I was instantly found in the corner of a map far away from the objective time after time after time and every other player as well regardless of the amount of noise we made. Great game but the player base is ruining it. And yes I am aware they have an ""anti cheat system"" but that didn't seem to stop the individuals I encountered for 2 hours straight in the morning time. I suspect kids or teens with nothing better to do than boost their fragile self esteem than by illegitimately ""winning"" at a game where if you lose your rank goes down. 2. Salt and Stupidity. If I play as the killer and I stand by a hook until the survivor dies then after the match the chat is a torrent of whining raging and crying by the survivors. Yes it's camping. HOWEVER if you camp a hook this lets the other survivors activate the generators with no worries and gives them valuable time towards the objective. Some survivors even stand in front of hooks spam flashlights and follow you around or sabotage a hook as you're heading towards it. I don't rage over these things which are indeed legitimate strategies such that camping on my end is. If I don't rage I expect no rage in return. Instead I get whining survivors who can't deal with me getting minimum 2/4 kills per match.",Dead by Daylight
