2017-06-20,0,0,34,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight is a good game hits the spot well in terms of mechanics. I'm happy to reccomend it on that basis alone. The game is enjoyable from both the perspectives of the killer and survivor and they feel fairly balanced. Being a survivor follows simple gameplay with minor complex detail featuring very heavy risk taking creating extremely tense suspenseful moments in sessions. Progression relys a little less on levels (though still a considerable aspect) and more on the skill and accumulated knowledge of the player which I find to be an especially rewarding mix. Killer gameplay is considerably more complex and relatively more tactical relying on cunning and trying as best you can to use the many mechanics available to track and chase survivors. New killers will struggle more than new survivors though as progression for the killer is split a similar way as for survivors but relies more heavily on both knowledge and skill.However as much as I enjoy playing there are some flaws that really shouldn't be there.There seems to be little consideration to mathmaking where new killers are pitted against teams of seasoned survivors and vice versa. Lobby waiting times can sometimes be quite lengthy too. With a decent playerbase there is no good reason to have both these issues simultaneously. There can sometimes be some lag in games though I've experienced less of this than what others seem to have. I've noticed some bugs. Disconnects are also a semi frequent problem where you can be kicked out of lobbies 15% of the time and with great frustration can be kicked out of the game roughly 5 10% of the time.I'd like to be able to say the devs are great and working on this but from what I can see it doesn't seem that way. They appear to have set focus on producing content for the game for it's longevity and for money. While the dlc is good and something I'd also reccomend they have clearly lacked as much focus or refused to work on the problems the game has.Despite this I reccomend This game. It's very appropriately priced so If you're interested in the concept it should be worth the money particularly when on sale.,Dead by Daylight

2016-09-03,0,0,1001,False,Recommended,If this game came at full retail of 30+ I'd tell you to stay away from it. However the price is very reasonable for the amount of hours I've put into this game. The game is constantly improving and new content is being added. Yes there are always issues the Devs are reletively new but are hard at work. I've spent 40 on games and barely played 50 hours so it's certainly value for money.The typical game spawns you in as a Survivor where you need to repair 5 Generators to power the doors and and make it out alive. It's easier said than done as each Killer has different mechanics and is a human player constantly looking to sacrifice you to The Entity by hooking you. There's plenty of longetivty to the game as long as you don't mind a bit of a grind. You can unlock character specific perks for both Killer and Survivor.If you're looking for a triple A quality game this is not your game this is a fairly priced Indie game. If you enjoy Cat vs Mouse gameplay and nailbiting close calls then this game is worth the moneyUpdate 660+ Hours at the time of writing this review. The game has its ups and downs but the game is certainly fun and for an affordable price. DLC Cosmetics are low price and the game is stricly NOT Pay To Win. All DLC Perks content can be obtained without buying the DLC. Frequent updates and new content with this game means you can't really go wrong. I just advise a thick skin as some of the community are unpleasant to deal with.,Dead by Daylight

I don't understand how they haven't already added this to the game it's such a basic feature.Button mashing really needs to go too. I don't want to have to beat the out of my $200 keyboard to play a $20 game.Some minor balance changes could be made as well but that's true of all competitive games.,Dead by Daylight

2018-10-13,0,0,647,False,Recommended,This review is written by someone who has played about 24h exclusively as a survivor take that into account.What this game excels at the atmosphere is great. In every game the atmosphere is roughly the same. It's tense mysterious exciting... But from minute 1 till hour 24 the player's perception of it evolves from a horror type game with a bunch of jumpscares and adrenaline rushes to an intense interesting PvP game where tactics and mindgames will lead you to victory and give you a real sense of a accomplishment. The matchmaking/ranking system is solid. Although it differs from match to match I rarely feel that I'm matched up with a team or opponent that are way below or above my approximate skill level. The foundation of this game is it's audio and ingame visual effects (not part of the HUD). From start to finish you need to rely on your visual and auditory senses to succeed. Game knowledge helps a bunch but learning maps by heart is not a thing in this game. It keeps you on your toes and this is where the game shines. Procedural generation of the maps means that you won't ever be matched up with diehards who know the exact layout of the map by heart. At the same time this keeps the game fresh for said diehards it's great!What the game does well The leveling/perk system feels well thought out allows a lot of variety in playstyles. The downside of this system is that it's opaque and you're not able to see the perks till the end of the game. This means that general knowledge of the game and awareness in a match is more important but it also means that you don't know that you're in a very unfavorable matchup till it's already too late because you can't adapt to the situation. This is both a point against and in favour of this game. The tutorial is comprehensive and provides rewards to get you started along with some essential knowledge. 20 euro price tag Queues are generally really short. Not having voicecoms ingame is both a blessing and a curse. The lack of people shouting at you or loudly munching cheetos with open mic absolutely saves the immersion of this game. At the same time it often makes you feel powerless against killers as there is no way to prevent your teammate from walking into an obvious trap.What the game does poorly Even though the pricetag is very low for a game with these graphics and of such quality Behaviour Digital kept costs low by utillizing a P2P model. This is understandable but because the game is hosted by the killer this causes latency issues which you would not experience with dedicated servers. Every few games I end up with a host with a not so great internet connection which causes rubber banding disconnects at the very start of the game or poor losers who will end the session by ragequitting. Related to above Sometimes matches don't get established at all as a disconnect happens during the loading screen but certain consumables with effects on only that match will still be consumed. This last one is not a fault of the game but due to the nature of it you can NOT listen to music or watch videos while playing this game. In order to succeed at it and enjoy it to it's fullest you can't have any other distractions going on while you play.Final verdict For this price buy it. Even with its flaws and many DLC packs you'd have to purchase to get the full experience of the game this is one of the best gaming experiences you'll ever have even if it's just as a casual experience for a few hours.,Dead by Daylight

Very fun to play with friends and it's such a fun fast paced game once you get the hang of it!In case you're wondering how this game is any different to Friday The 13th here's the down low Friday the 13th is a very repetitive game being that it has only one killer (or many that all just do that same thing) and many characters that have very indifferent stats.Of course the objective is the same as dbd. You must escape. Dead by Daylight is definitely not repetitive at all. It has many killers and many different survivors with their own perks. 2016-06-16,0,0,30,False,Recommended,I rarely write reviews for games but this game is VERY addicting. To make this review simple I'm going to write it as pros and cons. PROS *Can be a killer or survivor*Rarely run into a group of friends who have an extreme advantage with communication if you're the killer*Quick learning curve*Infinite level perks*Maps are random every round so survivors can't memorize layoutsCONS *Has a few bugs has crashed once for me*Can only make a lobby as a killer (Good and bad depending on how you look at it)*Loose items on death (If you buy an item for your character such as a medkit for example if you die while using that item it is gone for good until you are able to buy another one)Other than what I listed the game is very good. It has a few balancing issues but that's expected from a game that just released. Give it time and the game will be amazing. The best round I had was when I was the wraith and I went invisible the survivors didn't notice so when I found them I uncloaked and caught them all in one spot. I know this review isn't much but I hope it is enough to sway some people to trying the game. The negative reviews claiming the game doesn't have private friend matches are trolls and people that want to sit under their friends buts the whole time while playing. Loosen up play the dang game like it was meant to be played. If you want to play with your friends start a private match so its fair between YOUR FRIENDS. lol,Dead by Daylight

2017-12-31,0,0,28,False,Recommended,"Dead By Daylight New age ""Hide and Seek"" Dead By Daylight offers a scary theme is really creepy and suspenseful even with a friendly killer (killer who roleplays the match) in fact 2 of the games I had with a friendly killer were better than the random queues. Making it challenging however playing out a story where only 2 of us survived after 53 compelling minutes of running hiding planning our next move and repairing the 2 remaining generators in order to achieve our freedom. The game itself is amazing though the development team could do a little more to enhance the experience for everyone. I really love the development team for sticking true to its roots and not implementing a loot crate system opting for a more traditional in game currency and item buy menu this allows for a completely fair and equal playing field when in game. The team even shows its love for other games and classic movies by adding cosmetic changes for characters if you own certain games or buy the DLC (Not Mandatory). Even the addition of Freddy Krueger was a nice nod to the original classic ""A Nightmare on Elm Street"" as well as the Leatherface skin available as a DLC. Dead By Daylight has a lot of unique and original killers as well which are very appealing and fun to play as I personally would love to see movies or even shorts based on these characters maybe someday in the future. Sadly this game is far from perfect and though I enjoy this game so much it does lack variety... There are only 9 different areas known as Realms in the game which offer 22 map layouts across the Realms which tend to be slightly repetitive if you pay close attention. Also some killers do seem to have an advantage with their abilities and varying movement speed. Also with no voice chat it does make it difficult to coordinate with teamates though I am glad I don't have members of the toxic community screaming in my ear. Additions I would love to see implemented to the game is lobbies where you can join friends where you can set up custom game settings and create your ideal scary movie senerio as well as have a friend or yourself lobby as the killer. Roleplaying has a huge community and I feel the game could benefit so much more if they did add such a feature. I recommend this game to anyone who meets the System Requirements the development team really did make a gem and should keep up the outstanding work. Game 8/10",Dead by Daylight

2018-08-25,0,0,53,False,Recommended,"Fun game to play by yourself survive with friends is ok but usually just exploited to work around the ""anti social"" multiplayer aspects of the game. Teamchats like discord give survivors a huge edge that the game isn't balanced for. If you know what you are doing and know how to build perks and abuse pallets you can make an absolute mockey of killers especially killers who lack a way to get around pallet abuse. SWF or survive with friend troll groups are a thing in this vein and they are toxic. If you see a full stack of 4 pop in with at least 2 flashlights I'd say just close the lobby they are going to genrush/bodyblock/blind you and taunt you all game and there is little you can do. They tend to think they are hot for doing it despite pretty much anyone who is decent at the game knowing survivors have an advantage over most killers. That said playing the killer is really fun when the game works as intended and you have a group of 4 randos of varying skill scattered throughout the map who may or may not help each other. It feels great to finally outsmart that one slippery survivor who thought they could loop you only to win the mind game and slap them down.The game does have a lot of effects statuses and naunces that are not immediatly apprent so keep that in mind and be prepared to do a little research on these so you know what is going on. 2017-02-11,0,0,843,False,Recommended,This game is based upon 4 players being survivors and 1 player as the killer. It is a cat mouse game and matches usually last 5 20 minutes. Very exhilerating to play either side and enough content to keep it fairly fresh. I would recommend this game to anyone as I keep going back to it even after quite a few hours and this is coming from someone who easily gets bored with playing the same game all the time. There is a stream of new content all the time and the game is constantly evolving and getting better.However keep a couple things in mind 1. As with many games some toxic players can tarnish the experience. After a match is over there is a chat room open as long as the killer is in the lobby (the player playing killer runs the server more on that in a second). I advise new players to just leave as some people are s. Secondly survivors that aren't doing well in the beginning will often just disconnect from the game essentially screwing over the remaining survivors.2. There is a steep learning curve. Back when I got into the game a couple years ago the learning curve was steep enough and it has gotten a lot more complex since then with a lot of new content and fixes. At times the devs seem to try to balance the game more towards the high rank play and not for the new players. The frustration will be real when starting out. Possibly try watching some streamers play or watch gameplay on youtube when you start out to get an idea of how to play.3. There are no dedicated servers. Therefore there are some ways for killers to exploit this as the server is based off them and sometimes even with good internet you will experience some lag in game.,Dead by Daylight

2018-05-30,0,0,370,False,Recommended,"There is a lot to be said about this game. It is still definitley in its earlier stages and it does have some problems. I personally love it but I would advise anyone thinking about buying this to take what happens in this game with a grain or salt and there will be plenty of salt! PROS__________1. It provides an awesome horror experiance. With a broad amount of maps and Killers. You can pick your favorite psycho and terrorize strangers to your hearts content or you can pick a survivor and attempt to escape the clutches of your favorite movie villian or better yet a killer unique to the game. 2. This is a great game to play with friends or alone. You can get all that pent up frustration out. The experiance is as enjoyable as it is terrifying. 3. The Bloodpoint system rewards you for almost everything in the game and you even recieve in game currency as you level so you can buy cosmetics for your characters. 4. You can teach your survivor/ killers perks to other chracters. Which gives a broad spectrum of creativity in your playstyle alongside various ADD ONs and Sacrifices. There is a meta and it does exsist at higher ranks. But there are a lot of options if you are a casual player. If you are competative don't worry about it too much cause the meta here is basically opinion based and most everything works. I would stay away from Freddy and Wraith if you just got this game and are playing killer. Those killers need some serious balance changes. Wraith is getting better but Freddy is struggling hard. They still work but it can be hard. As for survivor Quentin is pretty bad. Ace and Nea are a bit lackluster but not awful. 5. The games visual and sound quality are amazing. The ambient sounds and graphics really immerse you into the game. 6. The game is growing and its a joy to watch it evolve and have new content be released. Even after countless hours of gameplay there is always something to come back to and it seems to only get better and better. CONS______________1. The community is a bit toxic. Even the developers seem to have a bad attitude towards the games development at times. Killers whine about balance constantly and how the game caters to survivors. Survivors whine constantly about just about everything. In my time playing this game I have found survivors to be the more toxic part of the game. The Killer role needs some love but it is not underpowered. The Survivor role is a bit strong but it is not overpowered. 2. Game Balance and bug fixes. Anyone who has played this game for any extended length of time will find a bug or will deal with something that is unbalanced or unfair. This game is still growing and a lot needs to be fixed. Yes it sucks but thats what happens when you play a game that is still evolving. 3. The developers take a very cavalier approach to the games development. There were statements made by the lead spokesman of the game mathieu cote that were very out of line and he had to issue an apology to the community. Even afterwards the apology seemed like ""damage control"" and personally anything out of his mouth should be disregarded. Just letting you know before you buy it. It is not just the game itself that is growing. The developers are slow to change core issues and address community backlash on both sides of the spectrum. The creators are learning how to manage and how to run the game and how to deal with being in the public eye. Just be aware you may need some patience a lot of it. No situation is perfect and keeping everybody happy is a harder task the more people that are involved.4. The community is small and sometimes you have to wait awhile to get a game. This is a niche game and a lot of people have quit and come back. But new people join everyday and old players come back. I would not say its dying. I hope not anyways. Even with all its glaring flaws I LOVE THIS GAME! 5. It can be a little grindy getting add ons and bloodpoints especially in the beginning when you are just starting out. They've made a lot of changes to make it easier but it is still a bit of a grind. Which is normal. Its just how the game is. It's not awful or anything. 6. There are a lot of bad mannered people that play this game. A lot of talkers and tea baggers and face campers and hackers and bug abusers. Just be prepared to deal with some s. Its like that in any online game. Just be prepared.7. The games price tag can be a bit pricey with all the DLC. I think it's worth it because it supports the game and keeps it around but it can be pricey. Overall this is a great game and I would recommend it 100%. It has a lot of problems but there is a lot of good about it too. I can't wait to see more come out of this game and where it all goes. GO HOOK ONE FOR ME! DROP A PALLET ON HIM FOR ME!",Dead by Daylight

2018-06-01,0,0,75,False,Not Recommended,"I'm rewriting my review as I'm approaching 100h played. It may seem hypocrite to have played this much and NOT recommend the game but the only reasons I kept going are because it's super addictive and I kept hoping with more experience and more grinded perks things will get better. They don't. Here are the things that made me quit and regret ever starting the game is a huge grind. The get an optimal build you will need to bring all your characters close to max. If you don't to put in a few hundred hours don't bother. the community is the most toxic I've ever seen as a gamer in 20 years. Survivors and killers literally hate each other both in game in chat and on forums. After playing killer so long I hate survivors too. I've taken so much abuse in game (tea bagging making fun of the killer exploiting etc) and after the game (in chat) that I geniuenly feel like this the game is not balanced nor will it ever be. At high level only a single killer is viable. The whole concept is based on survivors making mistakes. If they don't there is nothing you can do as a killer. The survivors have so many crutches and things on their side that the killer is powerless. Look up ""dbd de pip squad"" on youtube to see how bad it is. And any time the survivors are nerfed they cry out on forums like babies and ultimately devs get on their side because they are 4 time more in numbers. Nothing you can do. The balance is broken even more by SWF teams (nicknamed cheat with friends) that use external voice chat to circumvent most of the mechanics. When you encounter one of these you are about to have a really bad time. Worse the dev allow this but still balance the game around survivors not talking to each other. It's a farce.",Dead by Daylight

My only complaint is that if a killer doesn't like the setting an offering might produce the killer can disconnect. I know there are bans for exce4ssive disconnection but in the meantime the survivors still lose their offerings and occasionally their items as well. We work hard to get those things through bloodpoints and taking chances on chests it's not right that a wussy kliller can cause us to lose them. The game would be better with some sort of system to see who disconnected and only cost THAT person their items and offerings. 2016-10-01,0,0,336,False,Recommended,Dead by daylight is an excellent game. I dont know what else to say? What thats it? Nah ill give you moreDead By Daylight is a team based game where there are 4 survivors (or less if you are playing private match) vs 1 killer. The survivors objective is to repair 5 generators and open up a power based door before the killer kills them. Killers goal is to kill the survivors before they can do their objective. Thats a basic intro to the game and thats all ill say. The game has a unique set of perks for each character you play as and offerings for both the killer and survivor (offerings are burned at the beggining of a match to give an advantage to the survivors or killers (25% bonus blood points more item chests less sacrifical hooks etc.) Overall this game is very well thought out and all though the community of killers love camping survivors this game is extremely fun when you get good at it! I recommend it if you like survival horror genre games and you like teamwork,Dead by Daylight

2017-02-25,0,0,228,False,Not Recommended,"Honestly I love this game but I hate it more than I love it. Here are a few points why this is NOT worth buying. Toxic Community Fail to unhook someone camp someone to win do anything that's not in the meta and you're bad. After game chats are as toxic as Chrenobyl with no one actually taking blame or taking responsibility for what they did. Unessecary Competitive ""Resets"" and Bad Lower Ranks Every 13th of each month you're rank is reset to almost the lowest rank with mine 7 (the 7th highest) going to 19 (the second lowest). Rank resets are not only unnecessary as there is no ""placement matches"" or highly competitive tiering system (where only X amount of people can hold a rank) to warrant a reset as well as the fact that good players have to play with sub par or below average teamates in a RANKED TEAM BASED game. It just ruins the game to have to play with lower skill ranks that do not understand the game. Lack of an Unranked Gamemode Sure you can play with a party of just friends but lacking friends to play with causes you to have to play ranked because there is only ranked. Unranked public online games in Dead by Daylight simply do not exsist. Balance Issues in play Some killers such as the Nurse and the Doctor both counter key aspects to a Survivor's gameplay. The Nurse has an overpowered blinking ability that allows her to teleport closer to any survivor she's chasing. This also allows her to teleport straight through objects walls and pallets the latter being the keystone to a survivor's survival due to the lack of other options presented by the devs. Which brings up my next point the Doctor. The Doctor has an electrical field that can go through walls and objects and is on at all times that forces the survivor to scream and give away his position while within his terror raidus. These 2 killers take away the Survivor's ability to avoid killers one being the Nurse and the chase and the other being the Doctor and hiding. In Conclusion This game is only fun in the high ranks low ranks suck because most of the people playing are incompetent trolling are new or haven't played in a long time. I would not reccomend this game.",Dead by Daylight

2016-07-12,0,0,288,False,Recommended,If there is one thing I would add to this game it would be a camp point reduction. Listen I play a lot of video games and personally im not against camping in call of duty or battlefield or what not but in this game its points system is fairly well thought out and a simple tweak could save a lot of hassle. For those who havent a clue what im talking about when the murderer eventually catches you he will then hang you on a hook and when he does so 9 times out of 10 he will sit there and watch you like a hawk and there is no way to save you. Your friends cant help because he refuses to chase them if you friends try to grab you quick youll either die before you can run away or he'll just grab your friend from saving you and hang him on a hook too and if your one of the lucky few and get off the hook on your own he can just stab you and put you right back on the hook. I feel that all that is needed to resolve this issue is a simple point reduction system where if you stand within 10 meters of a hung survivor you will lose say 300 points every 10 seconds and if he dies while your doing so the sacrifice points are nerfed for you never giving him a chance to escape. Other than that flaw there are a few DC rank issues that need to be resolved but besides that this is a great game and definitely worth grabbing even if only for say 100 hours or so.,Dead by Daylight

2018-04-20,0,0,365,False,Recommended,So you are thinking about getting Dead by Daylight right? Well I am here to tell you how great this game actually is.First of all if you are scared of horror movies and the genre itself this game is fine for you. Personally I hate horror movies and I can't really watch them but I can play this game just fine and still have a great time with intense gore. Also something I would like to point out is don't let the bad reviews about bad balancing issues ruin the game for you. However they are partly right. Not every killer in the game is good in fact there are only three top tier killers (Hillbilly Nurse Myers.) Survivors can have ridiculously good perks but the killer can as well. Trust me anyone who is saying killer is impossible to play is completely wrong. There are plenty of perks that are amazing on killer here is a few BBQ &amp Chili (This basically lets the killer see any survivors that aren't near the recently hooked survivors) Nurse's calling (Let's you see the aura of healing survivors from about 20/24/28 meters away) and NOED or No one escapes Death (When the exit gates are powered a dull totem is turned into a hex totem that makes it so survivors are one hit so the killer can just hook everyone before they escape.) I know if you are reading this review you may have no idea what I am talking about and thats ok. This game has some bugs everyone knows that but so do other games. There isn't a single game out there that is absolutely perfect and has no bugs. In the end I feel like this game was very worth my $20 and I hope to keep improving as I keep playing this game.IMPORTANT If you are worried about the hefty amount of DLC for this game don't worry. The devs are implenting a way to unlock DLC characters by playtime so you won't have to pay to get them.,Dead by Daylight

2018-07-01,0,0,1,False,Not Recommended,I would rather not down vote this game since what I am complaining about is not really gameplay. However the fact that they got something wrong that is such a standard across games by doing it all different and wonkey stopping me from experiencing the gameplay I felt I should say something. I was also hoping it might server as a warning to others with something other than a single monitor to take serious considation before purchasing this game. Unless your ok with constant settings changes and losing your desktop layout everytime you want to play.This game does not follow industry standard for resolution handling. It handles changing the resolution through a single slider which only effectivly changes the resolution when the game is in full screen mode. When in a window the window size changes. There is no way to set the game window to anything but aspect ratio of the primary display.Why is this a problem?I have a multi monitor setup and use Nvidia Spanning to create a single desktop from all 3 monitors. This makes my desktop resolution 5760 x 1080. Because this resolution is what the game will base alll of its scaling on despite altering the config files to set it to my desired resolution of 1920 x 1080 the video appears zooomed in and with the top and bottom of the screen chopped off with no effective way to change it.From the tutorial play throughs and one miserable attempt at an online game I would not reccomend this game to people with muliple monitor configurations.,Dead by Daylight

2018-05-12,0,0,207,False,Not Recommended,"I stream this game a lot. 2 hours a day on stream every day. So I can safely say this This game is not good. This is not a well made game nor is it fun to play. It's fun for the first 50 hours and then it's just repetitive. Let me break it down here.For one thing the community is horrendous. This game turns the nicest kindest soul into a withering bowl of soup. You get into a game with a P3 (Prestige 3) Claudette with the name ""Pallet Loop God"" or some cringeworthy like that they crouch everywhere and touch one generator for about 3 seconds. What are they doing for the rest of the 20 minute match? Blinding the killer unnecessarily wasting pallets t bagging body blocking etc. They waste the killer's time and the survivors time alike. Then when they finally get caught they spam post game chat with stuff like ""camping noob"" or ""boosted killer"" or something they heard their older brother say on Xbox. These people believe that every time they have died it was always someone's fault. Also as you climb the ranks you will notice the game becoming less and less enjoyable than it seemed in rank 20. You see much like doctors and scientists rank 10's or less (ranks in this game go down to 1) all have a god complex which makes them play like booty. This is the most toxic video game I have ever played in all my years of gaming. Of course there's the killers. Killers are almost never at fault for anything they're here to murder you not be your friend. But there's this word that every gamer fears ""campers"". Camping in any game has some sort of negative connotation but with Dead by Daylight it's not unsportsmanlike cheap or even annoying. It's game breaking. In this game survivors are killed by being hanged on meat hooks which if they stay on it long enough will kill them. To get off of the hook you need to be rescued by another survivor. What Camping killers will do is stare directly at you while you are hooked. This prevents other survivors from un hooking you without either them dying or you being downed again. And it's not a question of ""will this killer camp"" it's a game of ""don't get hooked or it's gg"". For every 60 minutes you play this game (3 4 games) you will encounter at least one camper. AT LEAST. This obliterates the fear factor in this game and just turns it into another toxicity fueled show. Now I've talked a lot about how the players ruin the game which yeah of course they do. It makes up 60% of why this game is abysmal. But there's the one subject that nobody likes to talk about The developers themselves.Instead of writing a paragraph or two explaining why the devs are incompetent lazy and money hungry I am instead going to list things the devs have done/not done. Released a major game patch introducing a new killer survivor map and currency which was released on pc and Xbox. PS4 players had to wait about 12 days for the update because... well I have no idea why. Again incompetent. Prioritized micro transactions and cosmetics over bug fixes and more content. Oh hi you must be EA! Oh... no? Well what are you doing??? Neglected player feedback and continued with naive and unrealistic choices. If the killer leaves right when the game starts you will lose your item and offering. Devs are well aware of this. I suppose they think this is fine.Now listen you friend probably plays this game with 3000+ hours and told you you absolutely HAVE to get this game. As someone who used to be that guy telling my friends to get the game listen to what I have to say DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME. At least for full price. This game is worth $5 at most IMO. If it costs $20 + microtransactions and they spend it on making more CLOTHES and AESTHETIC implementations then their budget is not being spent correctly. This game is buggy boring tiring repetitive and just annoying. Please don't get this game. Maybe if the devs noticed a decrease in revenue they might actually try to fix it. Evan",Dead by Daylight

2018-07-19,0,0,164,False,Not Recommended,If youre a casual player please get this game you will have a blast.Are you competitve? Read first. Are you wanting to be a low ranking survivor? Well let me ask you some questions No patience?No self control?Do you get frustrated easily?If you answered yes to any of these questions do not get this game. There are some flaws in the balancing aspect of this game that will not be changed. They have been adressed to the devs and they wont bug on hard changes. Can you get rank 1 as a killer? Sure you can. Just be ready to not have fun because you're going to be playing a game that makes you run around a set path in the map chasing survivors where once you get close enough they will perform an action that resets the chase. Is there a way around it? Mmm yes and no. If you are good at mind games then maybe you can be successful. A perfect survivor vs a perfect killer survivor wins unfortunatley.Also theres other items and perks in this game for survivors that are also uncounterable and widen the gap of balance between the killers and survivors.In conclusion killers are forced into a meta where there is only a very very very limited amount of killers/perks to play and have a chance at success. Also survivors are forced into a meta where certain items and perks are so overpowered that it wouldnt make sense to use anything else.This means that there are so many other items perks and characters that in the competitive scene go unused. This leads to little variety. The same meta has been in place for a very long time. I doubt it will change.,Dead by Daylight

2018-06-13,0,0,51,False,Recommended,This game is one of my favorite games. This game has a lot to offer. It is fun thrilling and intense. There are four survivors and one killer. You must complete generators to open the exit while avoiding the killer. You are warned when the killer is there when your heartbeat intensifies. You can avoid the killers by hiding in the lockers are by using the flashlight to blind him. There are many tools to help you. There are medkits toolboxes maps keys and flashlights. In order to win this game you must work together. You have to complete five generators and you can't do them by yourself. You need to help your teammates by distractingthe killer and getting them off hooks. As a killer you must hunt down the survivors and hang them on hooks. As a killer you notice all of the hooks and generators and you notice when people fail skillchecks. Skillchecks are quick time events that happen when a survivor is healing themselves another survivor doing a generator and snapping out of it. If the survivors mess up it makes a loud sound and shows on your screen where it happened. After you hang the survivors the have a certain amount of time till they hit the half way mark they need to struggle to stay alive they can attempt to escape but there is only a four percent chance that you will escape. There are a variety of killers and survivors with more on the wayOverall this game is great and I definetly reccomend it. I give this game an 8.4/10 P115_CiTC,Dead by Daylight

There are a few bugs here and there but this game is fresh off the boat and I have no doubt that every legitimate problem will be addressed. I hope that the devs don't cave to the rage quitters. 2016-12-17,0,0,3,False,Not Recommended,Product received for free. Note I play on PS4 so things may be a bit different from PC. (E.G Nurse is not that hard to counter on PS4 but she's not played that often so this is just from my experience) Also the highest rank I've got up to was rank 11 so I most likely had crap killers.I play mostly survivor and from experience I can safely say that they are too powerful. I also play a bit of killer but the problem is that it's more stressful and difficult to catch the survivors. There are many reasons why killers are underpowered. Here's some of the reasons1. Totem placements Ruin can stall the game for a bit and prevent gen rushing. The problem is that you need to hope that the totem isn't in an obvious spot (E.G near a generator) otherwise the survivors will break the totem and now you have 3 perks.2. Nurse isn't viable on PS4 The nurse is by far the best killer in the game on PC. On PS4 if you're against a nurse it's always a free win. I've heard that it's due to framerate drops when blinking.3. Survivor perks Perks such as decisive strike and dead hard allow survivors to have a second chance when they screw up self care allows survivors to heal themselves back to full health easily and any exhaustion perks besides dead hard can allow survivors to gain some distance from the killer meaning that they will have a higher chance to find another spot to loop.4. Developers constantly listening to survivor's complaints Survivors constantly complain about everything being OP. First it was Freddy and then when they made the pick up rate faster for killer the forums were filled with whiny survivors refusing to adapt. Not sure if this is true or not but I heard that when the devs considered allowing the killer to close the hatch survivors complained about the change being too OP.I know this review is not perfect so if there's something wrong let me know. Sooner or later I'll hopefully not be lazy and come back to this review.,Dead by Daylight

It is very nerve racking playing as the survivor because you will hear a heartbeat when a killer gets close then fade away when he/she leaves. The thing that is complete t in this game is the ""looping"" (running around objects and dropping pallets) that cause so much frustration. You can get addons that will accelerate your speed to break pallets and movement speed but if the other player has addons that are maxed out they are impossibly hard to catch and it really just relies on picking the stronger killer.Buy this game on a sale if you like some cat and mouse but besides there are some hair pulling moments in this game that is built around its core design.",Dead by Daylight

2017-05-28,0,0,818,False,Recommended,"Fun game with a lot more depth and progression than the similar games on the market. Also has a number of bugs. I recently lost an ultra rare item with ultra rare add ons while using an item that should have preserved them in case of death aka the white ward. I reached out to support and let them know about it along with additional info like that I had recorded the entire match so had proof etc. and the next day got an e mail asking for some additional info. I provided that info and then noticed that they had sent another e mail immediately following the first that said my issue had been resolved! Yay! ...or not... here's the details of the second e mail verbatim ""Your request (*******) has been solved. To reopen this request reply to this email.Hi there Thank you for your information. We are currently aware of this issue with both White and Black Wards. I'm afraid we cannot restore your item. Please refrain from using them for now. I've gone ahead and logged your bug report in our database and we will get back to you if we need more information.Death is not an escape...The Dead by Daylight Team""So I was told by the developers that they know it's a problem my recorded stream won't help don't use the items that they put in the game to make it more enjoyable and I've been added to the list of bug reports.The game is mostly fun a great concept and new stuff is added fairly regularly. But this issue goes back for over 6 months from what I could find and plenty of other issues persist in the game as well for both killers and survivors. When they try to ""balance the game"" they kick it 40% the opposite way with heavy handed buffs and nerfs and everyone has to adjust to new mechanics that don't work any better than the old ones without ever addressing the actual problem. A concrete example is that killers complain about pallet looping. First fix was that a pallet can only be jumped 3 times in quick succession before being blocked but I was just in a game where a survivor jumped a pallet 20+ times with no blocking. Then when that didn't work they added a chase mechanic bloodlust that speeds up the killer the longer the chase goes on. Why didn't they just move the pallets and reshape the paths by making slight map changes to prevent the loop mechanic? They redo maps and pallet locations with updates but never seem to move or solve the actual infinites that killers hate so much. Survivor side biggest issue is face camping killers. They refuse to add a proximity timer to the bleedout for killers to dissuade camping but instead added an ""unhook from all angles"" that doesnt work at all or traps the survivor inside the hook pole and prevents any movement bugging them completely out of gameplay for the rest of the match.The game is fun the concept is awesome. But the balancing is like being on a see saw while intoxicated and the dev's really don't care about fixing the underlying issues that the player base complains about on a daily basis. I recommend the game but really dislike how it's been handled since release. You definitely get your monies worth but you get plenty of frustration for free to go along with it. By the time you finish the grind of prestiging your killer/survivor to top level and have all the fun perks... you realize you play find a lobby simulator and infinite tag more than the rest of the actual game.",Dead by Daylight

2018-08-06,0,0,21,False,Recommended,"*DISCLAIMER* I play through family share on another account so the hours I have are slightly misleading.This game on both sides of the coin both survivor and killer are fun. With the most recent update from the developers I feel as if the game has become truly balanced killers that were weak are stronger and more fun to play and that same perks were taken no matter the killer aren't needed as much anymore (I'm looking at you D Strike.)Survivors feel better to play and more rewarding as well. Instead of looping the killer around the same pallet or same set of ruins for minutes on end while my teammates hastily complete generators and where hiding from my killers was practically impossible it feels...better now. While a distraction is still neccessary on a team of survivors it feels better to play as the stealthy survivor instead of being a detriment and a weight. And it feels nicer to have a wider range of perks to pick from instead of the same 4 over and over again. I can go for a more altruistic line up focusing on saving and taking hits for my teammates or go for a distraction lineup looking to stall the killer long enough to get out. Or even a stealthy play around the killer type of lineup where I simply use all my perks to actively avoid the killer while doing generators. I feel like I don't need D Strike anymore simply because my escape options are better now or options to avoid the killer all together.On the other side of the coin killers feel much much better to play than ever before. The perk buffs along with the various buffs to killers and such make it to where knowing how to play one of the Trio of Meta (Huntress Hillbilly Nurse) isn't needed anymore if you want to climb ranks. Sure it's still recommended mostly because they're really good killers because of how fast they can stop chases and such but it's not needed. Your options are much better in terms of killers due to the various buffs that the Hag and Trapper got as well as general buffs to the killer like the pick up time or general nerfs to survivors like exhaustion cooldowns stopping when you run. Not to mention the various buffs to underground or not used killer perks like Bitter Murmur or Sloppy Butcher to make them optional choices.If you had asked me before the mid patch update if the game was good enough for the 20$ price tag there was a decent chance I would've told you ""no the game is horribly imbalanced. If you like wasting time and just waiting for a skill check to pop up which scares you more than a disfigured chainsaw wielding murderer then yes."" However with the new changes new balancing and the new perks which I didn't even talk about as well as the new killer the game feels amazing and refreshing to play again. So out of 10? This game now is a good 8/10.The bugs are still apparent so is the lag switching from the killers. But the core gameplay without all of that? It's fun again for both sides.",Dead by Daylight

2018-06-21,0,0,13,False,Not Recommended,"Long story short its hot garbage. Entertaining to watch but really boring to play. Don't let hype draw you in.Level 1 killers will be matched with hundreads of hours players matches are insanely tilted and very rarely are close if ever.Level 1 survivors will be matched with completelyed kitted out killers seeing a trend here? DLC killers are generally more powerful and snowball way to fast. The RNG in this game is so real I rarely see skill come into play... if ever. The netcode is laggy at the best of times and easily abused by the host (Killer) personally tried lagging my match out when I got near survivors and made it stupidly easier to get them.The maps are horribly unbalanced I honestly don't think there is a coherent design to them speficially Killer will just get dicked on certain maps and become impossible to catch anyone. Vice versa some maps certain killers excel on and will be able to chase players from the other side of the map.Killer perks are increadibly boring and dumb a lot of the time they take any idea of 'hunting' and just turn it into wall hacks the video game (They show survivor locations because they're doing x thing). The game forces you to play for hours and hours to get even a reasonable set of items to take into a match (Will be lost if you lose that match) so matches by nature aren't ever balanced.Fundamentally I don't agree with this style of gameplay design RNG items that make a huge impact in a match with random player level matchmaking a lot of the time just adds up to boring tilted matches that aren't ever exciting and give of the vibe that the developers are just going for the old ""You won it wasn't even a fair match but you did it and thats all that counts!""",Dead by Daylight

It was thrilling and new. It was fun and it felt very fair. Ever since release the developers have continuously tweaked the game's balancing. Early on balancing was great because not that many people had perks but as people earned OP perks and learned how to abuse the game and easily win as survivors the developers had to tweak it. The problem is the people who are gods at survivor are a tiny fraction of the population that plays this game. But the developers can't have that happen so they make the killers better. People playing survivor get adjust and get better with experience and the devs make killers better again. Now after a ton of updates the killers win nearly every game because the devs can't allow survivors to win if they are skilled. Now the only time you will win as a survivor is when the killer is really bad or you get lucky. Since 4/5 players in a match is a survivor that means on average the game has just above a 20% win rate for EVERYONE. If you play survivor and killer equally you will lose nearly every survivor match and win about every killer match.Overall the game isnt fun because of how easy/hard it is depending on which character you play.,Dead by Daylight

2016-09-30,0,0,91,False,Not Recommended,First I just want to say I think the game itself is great. I can see why people think the gameplay gets stale becaue you really are doing the same thing stuff every game just with different maps however as long as view each game as its own unique experience there's enough with perks and playing all killers and survivors to keep you playing for awhile. Why I have to give this game a negative review Matchmaking and lack of dedicated servers. The devs were finally able to get matchmaking to what I would I would consider a beta state at the time of this review since the matchmaker still doesnt find you a game every time and as you'll read in other reviews trying to queue with friends is seemingly a disaster. I've also experienced a time where I was put into a game and everything loaded but I was still searching for a match. Needless to say I lost a pip and didn't do anything the whole game because I couldn't move since my client thought it was still searching. These are just a few examples.To the point of dedicated servers the game is always hosted by the killer when matchmaking. What this resolves into is that if the killer has a poor connection or presumably your locations are too far away the killer always has the advantage as their actions take priority since they are received more quickly as the host. Much of the in game lag issues could be resolved with dedicated servers in my opinion and I've seen no evidence or heard nothing from the devs to state otherwise.I sit in anticipation hoping that one day dedicated servers come or a solution for laggy killers is found along with the completion of a hardly failing matchmaking system. I will probably continue to play the game continue to rage at laggy killers continue to curse the devs. I hope one day I can change my review but sadly in today's state of rushed releases I fear this day will never come.,Dead by Daylight

2018-01-10,0,0,923,False,Not Recommended,"So this game is great. It has an amazing concept unique killers as well as classics that everyone loves. Fun gameplay ideas for both sides killer and survivor alike. When I got this game years ago I was pleasantly suprised with everything about it. Yea there were bugs here and there and somethings werent exactly balanced but the game was brand new. It would get fixed right? The answer is no lol. As much as i love this game and want to say play it it's simply not worth supporting a group of developers who do not listen to and work with the community. Lately the main point for the crew has been ""new dlc hollywood killers new inovative ideas"". The game doesn't need new cosmetics and additions at the moment. It needs balance on both sides. Surivors have the end of the bug stick as they constantly have to deal with sound and exploit bugs. They have the more ""boring"" playstyle as pallet looping is basically the only thing they can do to survive and get points at a rate worth working for. And killers..... don't even get me started. I have never seen a asymmetric game that doesn't give the lesser side the advantage. So many good killer perks take nerfs and so many new killers get nerfed to the ground that at ranks 5 1 you upright can't use them and win. The hitboxes for both killer abilities and pallets are absolutely broken at times (its not fun hitting a hatchet that was clearly a miss or getting hit by a pallet from a mile away). And the wraith update.... WE WAITED 2 ING YEARS FOR IT and the wraith happens to still be the next to worst killer. WHEN DOES IT END. This game is great but their is so much more wrong with it that isnt't getting tended to. I still have hopes for the devs but with all the talk about new dlc killers and maps every few months it makes me wonder... ""when is the time to fix this game going to happen"". I recommend playing this game if you get it gifted or it you have it already or get it for free but I cannot recommend dumping more money into a company that refuses to listen to their community.",Dead by Daylight

Ridiculous...and really not fun to play against. I've had wins against Myers killers before but maaaan is it tough. If this is a skilled killer you better just sit there and afk cause your team will be done lol. Now I'm not saying all one hit killers are terrible the chainsaw guys can down survivors in one hit too except for them they need to CHARGE up their chainsaws and theres a huge audio cue where you can try to hide if need be. Myers on the other hand does not have much indicators if he is staring at you building up that damn tier thing he has till he's tier 3 to down you in one go. Ok I've ranted long enough but there you have it. Other than those issues I love this game. It's tense its fun and when you play with friends or a good team this can be super enjoyable. It's also fun running solo as a killer against other people. I've had many tense matches against super high ranking survivors and although I'll win some and lose some it doesn't matter I'm having FUN. It's a game. Good times.,Dead by Daylight

2018-02-25,0,0,474,False,Not Recommended,"It's really a pity. I have mixed feelings about this game and have already sinked many hours into it. However at this time i can't recomend the game. The sad thing is that almost only technical things which could be easily fixed destroy the game experience in the end. I will only commented on them because you can see from the other reviews that the game has a unique playstyle which has great replay value especially with friends.Issues no Ultrawidescreen support. Moreover they work actively against 21 9 users because they consider FOV a game mechanic and removed the well known tuneables of the Unreal Engine for FOV correction on 21 9. I would be fine with that if they would've at least implemend the rest correctly but no there are no ingame resolution settings and if you play the game in standard settings on a 21 9 monitor the picture gets stretched over the whole screen leaving you with an actual penalty compared to 16 9 users. What they see on their center of vision is now in your perepheral vision. The only counter against that is to adjust your desktop resolution to a 16 9 one each time you play the game or play the game in window mode which is not supported either you have to rely on Unreal Engine command line arguments. matchmaking Finding a game takes long sometimes. They have already improved this but its still far from good. Expect 1/3 of your gametime with searching for games. P2P game The killer is the host of the game. They have no dedicated servers. Which means a) You end up with highpings and lags. Especially if you have been matched with someone from the other side of the world. The games response to lag favours the killer As survivor you get stuck in objects experience rubberbanding etc.b) You randomly loose progress if anything happens to the connection The game can't know if the killer or your system had the problem and therefore the penalty for disconnecting randomly punishes you for no reason. constant bugs the game has a funny nickname DeadByBugs. And its real. The devs seem to focus in pushing out more content instead of fixing issues. Quality control is nonexistent. How can it else be that core game mechanics stop working? Take the chinese new year event ""Heartbeat"" was broken after the patch. Everyone noticed that in their 1st game after the patch. Why not the devs? The sad thing is that this kind of bug is not the one time exception that happens to everyone sometime. This kind of bugs happen regulary.What i cannot agree to though are balancing issues which are mentioned in a lot of reviews You can clearly see that they try to balance the game for the casual player which is a good thing because it's still way to hard for new players. The first 40 hours of gameplay are surprisingly unrewarding. If you endure that i am sure you will have some fun. Especially if you use the points generated by playing killer to level your survivors and play them with friends.That said i am taking a break from the game now.",Dead by Daylight

2016-09-16,0,0,65,False,Not Recommended,"tl dr don't buy this game. Just stick to watching it it's more entertaining by far. The developers don't support anyone except their streamer babies. Most of the ""positive"" reviews on here are actually negative. In real terms this game probably has one of the lowest user ratings on steam for an actual title.I could write a thesis on how awful this game is for reasons that are easily fixed or reasons that are primarily caused by the developers who just support public streamers instead of actual players.Initially I loved this game. As you can see I played for 65 hours. Now quite a few of those hours were just spent lobby jockeying which means you wait for the godawful matchmaking system to put you in a match and just hope the killer doesn't decide to leave because they're awful s. It happens a lot.No I enjoyed this game initially it's amazing to watch and I think that's what draws a LOT of the fanbase in and motivates a lot of people to purchase the game. It's so suspenseful and really engaging to watch someone if they're streaming it as a killer or a survivor. Actually playing it yourself isn't nearly as enthralling these days.When the developers are only interested in supporting the people who stream the game live (typically killers) who draw in more publicity and players and profits you see an imbalance in the game mechanics that has only gotten worse over time and has stopped me playing the game entirely. I went from playing this game for hours at a time every night with my friends to deleting it from my computer.Why? I played as a killer and a survivor. Primarily a survivor I wasn't great as a killer although it's very easy to get better. When I started playing I was a godawful survivor as well but you quickly gain proficiency and this isn't just because of character perks abilities and items. It's easy to be good at both. With each patch however more and more nerfs were aimed at survivors spurred by killers who found it ""too difficult"" to kill survivors due to sensible balanced game mechanics.The devs naturally were far too afraid to have any reasonable cricitism levelled at them by the people they wanted to protect the most to keep drawing people in. So they nerfed survivors. They nerfed their abilities their add ons and any reasonable strategy they could use against killers who already had the natural advantage by not being defenceless and being about twice as fast as survivors when they were just walking around.It became less and less rewarding to play as a survivor especially when the killers were entitled s who kept lobby dodging with no consequence.The developers would have you believe that this doesn't even happen ""Oh we got straight into a game the one time we played as survivors all you players are clearly just exaggerating there's no need to impose any sanctions on killer players at all."" A proposed change in a previous patch was to implement a longer delay for killers who left lobbies before they could start a new one. Note that the default original ""delay"" was five seconds. Yep. Also just forget it if you're playing in a group you could have a full array of survivors ready to go but you'd have to hit that tiny bullseye to find a vacant killer who didn't have any solo survivors already in the lobby. Good luck playing solo too the amount of lobby dodgers is phenomenal.Oh hackers are a thing too (here's looking at you China fanbase.). Griefers are also becoming more prevalent where a survivor and a killer know eachother and the survivor goes around following other players showing the killer where you are and sabotaging attempts to repair generators. So you know that's great for people who are farming ranks perks and bloodpoints. Not so fun for people who actually want to play.So overall I am sad and disappointed. I had some seriously amazing times on this game when it was good enough to play even with the matchmaking ""ready game"" and the lobby dodging killers. Now? No now it's too unbalanced to play and I wish I could get a refund. It's annoying when the developers openly mock the fanbase for legitimate problems and focus instead on breaking the game further just so it looks better on twitch for the killer streamers.Oh by the way? The newest killer? She teleports. Repeatedly. And can SEE THROUGH WALLS. Yep. The newest survivor? Uses her items just a TINY BIT MORE SLOWLY than everyone else. That should tell you enough.",Dead by Daylight

2017-07-02,0,0,769,False,Recommended,This is a game that's fun and exciting to play with your friends and even total strangers. Even though the bugs can drive me crazy sometimes I love this game so much and have been since the day it got released. I've met so many awesome people from all over the world with whom I was in a team with it's always a complete mystery when the strangers you're in a team with will save you when you're hooked or not. Most of the time I've seen that almost everyone is a teamplayer and many of them (myself included) even let themselves get caught after they saved a teammate from the hook in order to protect their injured teammate. Of course there are toxic people in game that'll curse you out in the chat afterwards but that's all part of the experience I guess. I know for sure that Dead by Daylight made me feel intense at times and people tend to react to that in a bad way. After all you're supposed to never feel safe while playing this game. The developers keep us up to date about their latest plans when it comes to changing and updating the game in their weekly streams and I applaud them for being so active and present in the community.I can say nothing else other than that Dead by Daylight is one of my favorite games of all time.,Dead by Daylight

2018-02-19,0,0,27,False,Not Recommended,This is an interesting game I've been watching gameplays since the beginning of this being out. However I've only started playing it shortly. Like many have mentioned this game has no tutorial save for few hints as you wait for the match to load. So unless you have a friend to explain every aspect of the game expect to be sacrificed quite a bit until you get the hang of it. The balance for matchmaking is ridiculous and not in a good sense. You could be starting out in the game trying to learn how to hide and escape and you face a rank one pro killer. Basically meaning you have no chance of winning. This is something to fix. Another thing is sensitivity to do actions. If two items are too close to each other you have to be super careful in order to achieve the action you actually want. Besides these two items this game is actually very entertaining with friends. This is not something I'd want to play alone even though it seems fun for the sake of communication. If you play with friends you can definitely communicate where killers generators and totems are. Which is extremely crucial as you discover in your gameplay. Without this it becomes extremely difficult but still worth the challenge if you want to play alone. Another thing to note and even though this is a tactic it's not one I particular enjoy (frankly it's horrible and I want it addressed) killers being campers. The game is much more entertaining if you don't camp the survivors because it keeps everyone on their toes. However if you camp we will literally leave the killer and the poor victim alone to complete the objectives and escape. What does this mean? One survivor one player ends up frustrated at the lack of gameplay and terrible match. I've been victim to this quite a bit and though my friends and I tried different tactics to survive this sort of killer it always ends with someone else (if not the original victim) being killed. This needs to be fixed or there should be a penalty for camping. So new players beware. And I mean BEWARE. Even though it is fun after you get the hang of it all these issues will drive people away unless there are friends asking you to play.,Dead by Daylight

2016-07-12,0,0,385,False,Recommended,Fun and addicting game with a few current caveats. This game has a fairly moderate learning curve. I find you don't begin getting the hang of playing survivor and winning successively until about level 30. At around this time more skills and items become available more frequently to allow you to gain the necessary 10k bloodpoints each match to gain a notch to improve ranking. Character progression and rankings are what drive repeated plays. Maps for the most part all vary game by game. The generators exits chests etc will all change each game. Some locations of things remain the same (such as any items or generators in buildings). A little work on this variety could help.At the current state the game still suffers from a variety of issues. You will be dropped from games randomly and have random crashes. This happens a good third of the time. There are also many issues where the game lags tremendously and suffers from very slow frame rates. This only happens in certain matches. For not much going on in terms of graphics or things to load this game should be a lot smoother and more stable. I have also encountered several issues in game such as my character getting stuck particular around areas that lead to a hill. This has caused me to lose valuable items during gameplay when my character was killed. I also had a game crash on me randomly causing me to lose 3 out of 4 notches in my survivor rank which was very frustrating after putting in all the work to gain them. If you quit or fail to gain 10k bloodpoints you should only lose 1 notch. I do find that one particular item the flashlight its almost completely useless. It is meant to stun the killer but I have never seen it successfully do so in any of the probably 50 or so games I have played as survivor or killer. I have used the flashlight to stun (as indicated by gaining of blood points) but it doesn't seem to have any or much effect on the killer at all. I feel the devs should replace the flashlight with something more useful especially considering all the useless add ons one spends on the flashlight.Overall though I find this game really fun and addictive to play once you get past this issue. If the devs are able to increase performance stability and continue to update this game with more items customization locales and characters they have a real gem on their hands.,Dead by Daylight

2017-08-09,0,0,85,False,Recommended,"This game has some issues but it's pretty fantastic. I haven't spent this much time on a multiplayer only game since Science and Industry.Survivor and Killer are both a lot of fun to play although I did prefer Survivor. Survivor XP rates could be higher it seems like Killers have it easier getting Bloodpoints each match (having played both). XP rates in general could be a lot higher the game is almost a Korean MMO with how slow the vanilla leveling rate is. There was recently a Triple Bloodpoint event (3x XP) and that even felt too slow.Maps being free to play even if you don't own the pack as long as the host (Killer) owns the map is nice but the are still overpriced.I feel like the game would have more teamwork from the Survivors end if you got more XP if more Survivors escaped. As it is if someone's hooked and the exits are up even if it's an easy save most people will just head to the exit. If you got more XP for having more people saved people would be more likely to take the extra 15 seconds to get someone else out because it benefits them.It doesn't seem to be optimized well as at max settings it utilizes far more resources than it should given how it looks and how small the tech is for the game (no AI to process only five people total and the maps are medium sized).I love how the menu music is the same theme throughout but each section uses different instrumentation. Main menu is piano Survivor screen is acoustic Killer screen is distorted guitar. The music doesn't stop when you change between these sections this is what's really cool it just flows into the new instrument for the section you're on continuing at the same part. It adds to the atmosphere very well it's a simple technique but it's really effective. Despite being a multiplayer only game that has essentially no story except for what you find in the instructions and some quotes when leveling up/tooltips it's a very immersive survival horror environment.Entering the Killer's basement is always tense. It's exciting to hear the terror radar go off (an increasing heartbeat) hide and evade the Killer's vision by constantly positioning yourself correctly behind a tree so he doesn't spot you then he runs off and you make a safe escape. Or working on a generator that's almost finished the terror radar goes off an ally baits the boss in another direction and you finish starting the generator. A favorite of mine is the escape hatches. I still haven't figured out how to open one with a key (haven't got the right key yet) but at certain points in the game there's a hatch in the ground that opens and if you find it you immediately escape. In one of my first games I was the last Survivor alive I didn't know how to play yet so I was just running around not sure what to do. The Killer started chasing me I didn't want to die so I kept running I accidentally came across a hatch and exited through it. I had no idea they existed in the game and that escape was so well timed it's moments like these that keep Dead by Daylight so compelling even though it's ""the same thing"" over and over. There are all these random mini stories that happen throughout the game through the interactions of players.A lot of people think the Huntress is overpowered but I like dealing with her more than the Doctor or Michael. The game feels really balanced. Beginner Killers have an easier time getting rewarded than beginner Survivors but as long as you get matched with at least one other Survivor that knows about body blocking/what chicken winging on the hook means/not to insta unhook the Killer is going to have to work for the kills.The most frustrating thing about the game is when you join as a Survivor get found and hooked by the Killer within about 15 seconds and die because no one comes to help you. You end up spending about 5 minutes finding a lobby/waiting for match to start/loading into match to die in two minutes and get 5k bloodpoints because of how RNG was with the placement and/or the other Survivors totally abandoned you that early.Another frustration is the item system. There are a few offerings that can be used that hugely tilt the game in either sides favor. Pitch black lighting means the Killer is going to have a really hard time finding you and the item that lets the Killer kill anyone who's downed if they've already been hooked by them makes for some really fast one sided matches. This should be given another look at.It's really good overall I'm certainly not bored of it yet but the biggest hurdle to most will be how long it takes to level up in this game.",Dead by Daylight

2017-10-23,0,0,179,False,Recommended,I honestly find this game fun it has an almost toxic community. Hey play your way but don't insult new players still learning but if there is a weak link sometimes you have to snap it. But I love seeing survivors coming together to save each other just don't farm your fellow survivors! As a killer main I love to let my survivors go which probably is why I don't rank up. The entity hates me! lol You can get 8k in every category and earn over 20k experience for it but do you get any pips? Nope. So as a killer I like to help my survivors out. This is often disliked as I mean what is a killer if not someone who kills? Why does he just farm blood points and let you leave? Well I dunno ranking system is all sorts of stupid for survivors and killers right now so blood points is all I care about but I almost exclusively ignore Sacrifice category as it tends to make survivors salty. I like my survivors sweet and tasty so many I store a few in my cellar so what? I'm not like those killers who pile up the body count and play Nurse just to get blocked. Nah I play the Doctor and he always gives out lolipops and madness. 2016-12-18,0,0,358,False,Not Recommended,This game has great potential and was released roughly 7 months ago. However the lack of support for game breaking issues since it's release makes me give it a negative review.For starters the Solo Survivor does not work. You must go around it by using Survive With Friends and Escape from the in game overlay and then click Ready in order to start searching for lobbies. After doing so you may join a lobby but 80% of the time you will be thrown back to a menu screen. There is a Join A Lobby button. It also does not work. If you choose it you will get a bouncing logo which is an endless loop that will not stop. This also applies to Quick Play at the main menu. You cannot back out you cannot Alt+F4. You can only CTRL+ALT+DEL and close the game manually via Task Manager. Then you can relaunch the game and try again. So Solo Quick Play and Join A Lobby are broken and have been since Day 1. That was June 14 2016. It's going on February 2017. Any questions? Good! Moving forward.Now let's say you launch the game and select SWF (Survive With Friends). Select friends to play with or Escape out to Ready up for Solo Survival. Make sure your friends are in the party before clicking Ready or you will have to repeat the process. (Or them)Now that you and your friends (if any) are in the party it's time to ready up and begin searching. This is where you either wait for 6 10 minutes before joining a party or you get a loading screen that ejects you from the party and sends you back to the main menu. Once again you must repeat the process. You will do this 7 out of 10 times guaranteed.Now let's say you get into an actual lobby (hosted by the killer). You won't know who the killer is until the match is over but that's not important. If the killer decides to not play you will be ejected back to the main menu where the process will have to be repeated again for joining a party and a lobby.... Painful right? There's more!If you're in the lobby and not all people are ready you can chat to them. Are they there? Probably not. They are most likely in the infinite loading screen (as stated above) and they do not know they are in that lobby. They cannot Ready Up. When 4 players are present (whether they are actually there or not won't matter) The Timer will count to 0 00 and thus launch the match. If only 3 people are ready the 4th will cause the game to show the loading screen to Ready Players until he/she is either dropped from the match or they have manually closed the game in turn allowing the match to proceed with 3 survivors. If only 2 are ready and the other two are on hiatus the wait will be longer and you may even be thrown back to the main menu and have to begin the process all over again. Yes again.Remember the timer counting to 0 00? If all players are ready the timer will jump to 0 05 and continue to 0 00 and the game will start. Maybe. If all players are NOT ready my suggestion to you is to leave the lobby at 0 10 and begin searching for a new lobby all over again. Yes again.Isn't this fun!? I know right? We haven't even played the game yet and we've already spent 15 20 minutes just trying to get it started!,Dead by Daylight

2017-01-08,0,0,176,False,Recommended,Okay so I'm just going to be brutally honest and I'm sure most people will agree. I have never written a review before but this game has frustrated me to point where for some reason I think writing this make me feel better. The game is extremely fun. Even with all the things that are annoying I still play and play. THEY WILL FIX THESE THINGS. SO PLEASE GET THIS GAME. There is just a couple things that grind my gears. FIRST when you hit 'Find a lobby' to play solo and it immediately says 'Failed to join lobby' you're sent to a throbbing hash mark loading screen bug. Where you then have to hit control alt delete task manager and close your game. I'd say this happens 3 out of every 4 times I try to play solo. I have to hit survive with friends and then invite no one to get into games solo. Second buggy thing When I do play with friends I experience ridiculously long queue times where most of the time you'll get into a lobby and then be sent back to menus. However if you do get into a lobby and someone doesn't ready up? That is a sure sign that they will most likely disconnect and you'll start a man down against the killer. Which brings me right to the next thing. I'm tired of putting on awesome items just to find out that two people disconnected and I now have to face some try hard killer with only one other friendly. I then easily get killed losing an awsome item that I can't get back. There needs to be an item lock or save when multiple people drop before the game starts. Third and finally the last main issue in my opinion is hook camping. I know this is a 'strategy' but maybe they can do something about increasing your luck to get off the hook if the killer is within a certain distance. Otherwise players will see the killer is just standing next to you and let you die. Like I said before even though these things are wrong I still play and am very much addicted. Therefore I recommend however surely at least the buggy things will be getting fixed with next update,Dead by Daylight
