2018-04-24,0,0,18,False,Not Recommended,"Pros since launch Lobby Simulator is fixedCons since launch Oh boy.Dev team is bad. Literally told killers to play a different game if they were frustrated.And why shouldn't killers be frustrated? The survivors have several perks that can be summed up as second chances. And boy do they have a lot of them. Nobody is afraid of you as the killer hell they survivors will outright bully you.But Jack how can a survivor bully a killer? Well I'll tell you.First up survivors are slower than you... barely. Just barely unless you're the nurse in which case they're fast. Coincidentally she's the best killer and I'll say why in a second.Survivors have access to these things called pallets which are scattered throughout the map leaning up against walls in choke points. They can drop these pallets on your face and that stuns you if it hits you. The pallet also can be vaulted over by the survivor and broken by the killer (this takes a bit and cannot be done until it is dropped.)The result of this is the survivors will do something called ""Pallet Looping "" where they run around the choke point near the pallet until you're just about to catch them at which point they drop the pallet in your face and run away usually while teabagging to the next pallet loop site.The nurse is good because she can teleport through pallets (But can still be stunned if it hits her mid teleport because reasons).Pallet loop is the big deal but flashlights also exist. You know the flare gun in friday the 13th? Imagine if it could be used multiple times. That's the flashlight. See when you pick someone up to carry them to a death hook you can't move. Yeah that's a perk in DBD. Everyone runs it. Also you have to take them to a hook to kill them (barring very specific circumstances) and they have to stay on it for a while in order to die and yes the others can pull them off.TLDR the Killer is insanely frustrating. Nobody is afraid of you. At all. You are the object of contempt.",Dead by Daylight

2016-09-14,0,0,103,False,Recommended,My review is untraditional and focuses on an aspect of the game some people may not have even considered. Dead by Daylight is a survival horror game where you can take on the roll of a survior or serial killer. At the time of this review there are four serial killers however I find myself only using one for one particular reason. The Trapper is the killer of my choice because he is the easiest to use when trying to convince other players you are friendly. Instead of playing the game as I am supposed to (which is extremely fun) I found even more enjoyment in not killing at all. When a player trusts you you can follow them around and they will follow you around. They might try to get you to hit them so they can heal each other you can put down traps and let them disarm them they might have you walk into traps. All of these can earn you both points so it is beneficial to everyone. In truth I bought this game to compensate for the wait of the Friday The 13th game I would not recommend buything this game if you are looking for a substitute for the Friday The 13th game but I would recommend this game in general. Playing the game as intended is just as fun as my method and I enjoy running around as a survior doing everything I can to live. One final note is that if you get this game I would recommend using a controller playing as a killer with mouse is fine but a survivor with the keyboard is a quick and easy way to hurt your hand.,Dead by Daylight

2018-12-12,0,0,74,False,Not Recommended,Let me start by saying that DBD is not a terrible game. In fact the only reason I chose to not recommend this game is because there's no option to sit on the fence.DBD is an asymmetrical survival horror game like many other multiplayer games of the same genre.Also known as a glorified game of hide and seek.Simply the reason I dislike this game is its ostentatious sense of repetitiveness. Now you could argue that all multiplayer games are repetitive DBD's core objective involves restoring generators to a working state by completing skill checks such as the objective of a multiplayer shooter is to fend for your character's life.However I find that the repetiveness of other games can be overshadowed by constant action. DBD's action virtually only consists of Killer/Survivor chases but even then it feels like there's something lacking. The chases are not exciting just as much as sitting on a generator for five minutes pressing SPACE occasionally is not exciting. I believe this game is tedious and requires a developed virtue complex. Maybe the only reason I can't enjoy this game is because I'm not patient enough.Now I'm writing this review from the perspective of the Survivor. I cannot comment on Killer since the few matches I played I was horrible and could not truly apprehend the fullness of the gameplay. But even as the 60 or so hours I have on Survivor I cannot recommend it.Of course I cannot say whether you would like this game. DBD has its flaws but as I said when I started the review this is not a terrible game. It's enjoyable enough for a cheap thrill.,Dead by Daylight

2016-07-28,0,0,234,False,Recommended,So I recently went back to the Dead by Daylight page only to find I had left a negative review. And I have to say they have adressed nearly all of the issues I had with the game since then. Though the game isn't perfect most of its problems stem from the community which is much better than just having a broken game.There's not a whole lot of in game glitches. They happen from time to time but I haven't gotten stuck in a wall/hook since October of last year which is a major improvement from the game at the start. Also a system has been put in place to try to catch cheaters and to report people who engage in toxic behavior. THE DEVS ARE LISTENING!Though I question the pricepoints of the DLC packs I have to say that I'm impressed with how much the devs are pumping out good content for the game. Aside from the whole second chapter every single one of them has been of high quality (in fact they keep getting better). And on top of that the devs have stated that they are going to redo the entire swamp map and have buffed the hag since release to make her not entirely useless.I can't say how glad I am that I stuck with this game. Though I have to say if you do go to buy it be prepared for a somewhat toxic community. There are issues with the game like I said but again most of them come from the community. Though it sucks and I don't always have a good tiem with the game when I play it I don't think it's fair to fault the developers for it.Oh and the 1.5 update optimized the out of the game so that it actually runs well on my card even on bigger maps DOverall I give it like a 7/10. It's more fun when with friends but if you're looking for a grindy asymetrical MMO type game to sink your teeth into this is it!,Dead by Daylight

2016-10-01,0,0,1420,False,Not Recommended,I am playing Dead by Daylight now for around 900 hours.The game is an up and down all the time.If you have a thick Skin and can handle rude toxic and rage. You re good with this game.Dead by Daylight is a competitive Game so there is really much salt and toxic in the community.Now let s go to the Game itself.The Developer spends much time into the game to bring it forward. They are all the time trying to balance the game. Well in the end it s not really working one side is all the time complaining they are weak and the opponent side is to strong. That s true on one side but they do rebalance things and so it changes on some point and then change back. Dead by Daylight is a 1v4 Multiplayer game.That mean s there are 4 survivors playing against 1 killer. The target of the killer is killing them all and the survivors have to do 5 gens and open the exit gates. They most common key for survivors is to play in a team sadly many don t do that so there are a bunch of PERKS you have to have. (Self care is a must have). It is frustrating sometimes if the full team dies because of no team play. But well just join the next lobby and try again )Killers are Alone on their journey to kill the survivors in low rank killers are really overpowered and you will die lots of times but it doesn t mean anything you get blood points to get better perks and stuff. In high Rank well then Killers are really hard to win against skilled pallet loopers and peeps using 369S and met builds. But in the end if you don t care about a full 4 man kill round or every single game an escape it s really funny.I would all of you suggest just ignore the after chat when the hate and insulting rage starts . Well since it is a competitive game peoples get mad pretty fast.Well and there is one thing you will face in the game pretty often Camp Killers they park their avatar right in front of your face makes it impossible to unhook and rescue you from the hook. In that case the one on the hook is well fkd up.Pros of the game + really good game concept+ every single game has his own flair and thrill+ Graphics are really amazing+ very cool atmosphere + Perk system (teachable perks you can use later on other characters)+ Offerings to give each game a own flavor+ Dev s are really into releasing new content and fix bugsContras of the Game Sometimes long lobby waiting times balancing (low Rank killers to overpowered high ranks the other way) if you face a skilled Nurse your 90% of the time Dead Matchmaking is terrible since the release of the game The Killer ALWAYS host the game it s an P2P game so if you are into an killer with potato internet or you face a Region hopper your game will LAG so much sometimes it s impossible to play. No implemented Ping indicator to see if the others lag or not you need to use a 3rd party tool called MLGA (Make Lobby s Great Again)Awesome Game with the potential to get addicted !,Dead by Daylight

2017-09-12,0,0,38,False,Recommended,"It's a pretty fun game the community has a bad rep but can actually be some pretty cool people offering tips to newer players and providing a generally positive atmosphere.Playing as a survivor can be genuinely terrifying when up against a solid killer when you just get started but that novelty kinda wears off after a while and it feels like a slightly spooky game of hide and seek. Still a very fun game of slightly spooky hide and seek though.As a killer you end up chasing people around and running in circles a lot trying to smack people and give them to your tentacle god thing. This tentacle god thing will only accept people if they're served to him on hooks because reasons. It's pretty fun if you're into that sort of thing (no judgement).The gameplay can get pretty repetitive after a while and at higher levels people start employing the same strategies over and over (because they work) and then things start to get even more repetitive. Plus the progression system is really geared towards frequent players so you won't be as effective a killer/survivor if you don't play a lot.There's a solid variety of killers to choose from with wildly varying abilities while the survivors have some differing traits while still feeling fairly similar. They all still repair generators and try not to get smacked and sacrificed.All in all it's a pretty fun game to play once in a while so the gameplay doesn't get too old but it does incentivize you to play more if you're into that sort of thing.tl dr community's actually pretty nice survivor gameplay is spooky for new players but becomes less spooky over time killers are ""It"" in this game of hide and seek gameplay gets repetitive progression is geared towards frequent players pretty fun 6.5/10.",Dead by Daylight

2018-11-17,0,0,98,False,Not Recommended,Product received for free. I am a fan of RTS games. When developing them a lot of time is spent making sure that the different units on different teams are properly balanced so that one team dosen't have an unfair advantage over another. From playing a few of these games I came to the conclusion that game balance and play testing was something that was taken seriously in the industry. Then along came Dead by Daylight!The developers seem to be randomly buffing and nerfing different perks and features of the game without playtesting any of this with real players or games. Combine that with sometimes poor communication with players and it is easy to become lost on which features work like they should and which have been nerfed (flashlight!). Perks change as well and there is no clear communication on screen as to what they do. This results in the player thinking that they are hidden and in fact the killer has a big ol' glowing outline of where you are on screen. Lots of deaths due to you thinking you are hidden and are not or that what you are doing is going to bamboozle the killer and they completely ignore it and cut you down. It sucks. Players rarely seem to team up sort of like playing Team Fortress 2 on a public server. So what should be a collaborative effort against the killer can turn into a five way brawl which again up ends the gameplay mechanic.Combine this with some mildly toxic behaviour and it's a real joy to play. Survivors disconnect when they don't like the setup or it looks like they are going to loose. This means that you are now one or two players down. The Killer can disconnect when it appears that they are loosing and the whole game is gone. One more minor point whoever built the props like the hooks in the game? The look terrible no I mean REALLY bad! Like they were made by a preschooler with Quake Army Knife and MS Paint kind of awful.,Dead by Daylight

2016-11-25,0,0,308,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight combines the horror genre with a moderately decent cooperative experience and multiple challanges. The game may grow repetitive but the DLC and new combinations of perks often spice up the gameplay. 2018-11-23,0,0,667,False,Recommended,This game is way more fun than I thought it would be. There is some hostility/toxicity in the community but it's mostly because it's designed to pit survivors vs killers and it fosters that mentality. The game is constantly being updated with new content both cosmetic and maps/characters and they have a F2P like model in place where you can earn in game currency to unlock characters/cosmetics that you could also buy. Some cosmetics can ONLY be bought and some characters are licensed so they also can only be bought. All in all I highly recommend this game it goes on sale very frequently (50% off at the time of writing the review) and anyone on the fence should at least get it while it's on sale. If you do buy it I also highly recommend buying the trademarked/licensed bundles if they are also on sale as well. Most of the survivors/killers that you unlock are very valuable/fun and since you can't get them through in game currency you might as well grab them while they're discounted. The following are the ones I urge you to buy The Saw Chapter Leatherface/Cannibal Nightmare on Elm Street and The Halloween Chapter. The rest of the bundles/characters can be unlocked once you play the game enough.,Dead by Daylight

2019-01-09,0,0,62,False,Recommended,"Okay.I needed some time to get my mind right before I wrote my initial review. After careful thought and consideration here's what you're going to get. Let's start with the bad because it's always better to end on a good note. The game tends to have inconsistent connections. (Now before people with a solid bajillion up/down speed jump into the comment to fight me with pitchforks and Velveeta cheese blocks yes I am aware that the best connections are wired. Yadayadayada.) Lag spikes are one thing. It's incredibly frustrating as Hell to see that you made an escape for a moment from the killer and you get sliced to bits all because the game finally caught up and gave you a stable connection. Thanks. Or who doesn't love going for a hooked survivor and realizing that what you see on your screen (unhooking of the survivor then promptly letting them go) is actually not what is actually happening (you standing like a goofball near the survivor with the prompt reminding you that you can actually unhook said person) Have you ever got into a nice groove with skill checks? Yeah me either. So just when you need that skill check to heal to do a generator whatever players will hope with all of their glory that lag doesn't poop everything up. The game crashes more often than it should. One of my aboslute favorite (not) moments of the game is having a decent loadout a competent team and then...the game freezes. I understand that at the time of my review (9 Jan 2019) it is indeed winter time. I don't think that necesarily explains the frequent freezing. All terrible jokes aside this happens more often than it should and really takes an otherwise immersive experience and makes it rather...sucky. If you want to know what it's like to be in a toxic environment give Dead by Daylight a try. What makes the mechanics of the game really rewarding is when the survivors work together. Anyone not looking to help others during the game is toxic (there I said it) as the game often favors the killer. I've played with players that will walk around all game never thinking to work on generators but will carry their medkit around and heal themselves when they get hit. Or how about the person that hasn't been hooked once never thinking to sacrifice themselves for a moment just so a person on hook 2 can buy some time and rethink their strategy? Yup it happens. I mentioned earlier that the killers have an advantage. They do. Still some players feel the need to cheese the game. Sometimes you'll play a game and players will disconnect before the round starts. Instead of thinking to at least help the disadvantaged survivors farm bloodpoints on a map that asks you to fix five generators on a map that's either too big for anything less than four survivors to do or too small to avoid being detected to begin with. Remember that time you worked your butt off to escape via hatch and the killer camped the door so you couldn't escape? I love that part (no I do not). Legion at the time of this review is OP. New players and ""experienced"" alike can glide through the game with no challenge at all and kill everyone with ease. It's a nice pick up of BP per game so why wouldn't people do it? Unless I'm missing something the lack of in game voice chat/support is surprising and disappointing. I understand not everyone is privy to it but to not even have the option at all is kinda suck.Now for the good.+ While the game puts survivors at a disadvantage careful planning teamwork and communication can and will often get you out of tough spots. Naturally someone is going to die as a survivor. New players be prepared to die and die often. At the same time gaining more knowledge on the pacing of the game how you should play etc. is key. + Grphically when it's not dropping frames like that one time you were so shocked you dropped something on the ground it's really nice. The survivors look unique. The DLC characters resemble their likenesses as they should (except Freddy he looks like a bad remake from the bad reboot) + The mood and vibe (when the game doesn't drive you up the walls) sucks you in. The heartbeat slowly but surely getting closer to you while you're trying to rush to do something is a nice touch. The killers sound like they should and some survivors that shant be named breathe extremely loud ever louder while they're injured and internally you wanna tell them to ""shut the heck up"" but you can't. It's a video game. But you do it anyway because you know you'll get caught if you're breathing like you've just came out of a Taco Bell bathroom during the summer time. + It's really fun with friends. It's the best when you're playing with people you know and can talk with. You know what you're doing everyone has a job and you're more likely to survive or help someone live.On a scale of one to ten I'd give it a respectable score. I can't say at this time without certainty because regardless of how I feel today I feel that the feeling would make me regret going too high or too low depending on the W/L ratio the skill level of the players involved etc. I'll leave you with this. I got this game on sale I play with friends and randoms and I believe I got my money's worth. So there's that.",Dead by Daylight

2017-11-24,0,0,581,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight has been out for a while now but it earns recognition for having one of the most original game concepts in the past 5 maybe 10 years even. In the game you can play as a survivor or a killer. Both offer a very different gaming experience. As a survivor you team up with 3 other players and you need to repair generators scattered across a map. Meanwhile another player takes on the role as killer and hunts the survivors down. Survivors have a third person perspective and can't attack while killers have a first person perspective and each have their own signature weapons and abilities.I'm not going to go deep into the game mechanics but as you play you'll get points for doing various actions. Survivors need to repair search evade and often heal their team mates for points. Killers need to track down damage generators hurt and sacrifice the survivors on gigantic hooks spread across the map. Earn points and spend them in the 'Bloodweb' which acts like a skill and item tree. You gradually unlock new perks that offer new types of variety in gameplay.What keeps the game so interesting is that you really need to adapt and try to think like your opponent. Every match is a battle of wits and mindgames. Sometimes you will get unlucky but learn from the situation and you will eventually succeed. Escaping a match unscathed or eliminating a full team of survivors. Both will give you a whooping amount of satisfaction.EDIT 2018 This game remains a lot of fun. I've put the most hours into it for all of 2018. New interesting killers and survivors have been added. Back in June a cosmetic store was introduced. You can now spend saved up currency on outfits. No lootboxes you either pay and get what you want or grind your way. A fair business model. Good job devs!,Dead by Daylight

2017-11-19,0,0,335,False,Recommended,Dead by Daylight is a terrifying horror game in which 4 survivors are pitted against 1 killer in an unnerving fog filled map. Whether it be in the iconic neighborhood of Haddonfield from Halloween or the Coal Tower of the Macmillan Estate the goal for both sides remain the same. Survivors must repair five generators and escape while the killer must sacrifice the survivors to the Entity a arachnid like monstrosity of the sky. This game is fine tuned to give you a scare with horrifyingly beautiful graphics and ghastly sounds. Everything in the game is more than adequately detailed with dark lore to add to your experience. Along with that the overall gameplay in Dead by Daylight is polished for the player's experience. Dead by Daylight has relatively few bugs and those that do exist are rarely gamebreaking. Content in this game is well fleshed out and no two experiences are ever the same with the numerous combinations of items to take into matches as well as game changing offerings.Finally Dead by Daylight is still being actively worked on by its developers with Freddy Krueger being released into the fog only last month! (Edit Now the Spirit has been added and with the huge success of the Hallowed Blight event another killer is being teased!)All in all I highly recommend Dead by Daylight to anyone thinking of purchasing it!,Dead by Daylight

As long as you're not expecting a win ever. There's an unfortunate RNG that takes place. I had a run of games where I would start within visual range of the killer. 2016-06-17,0,0,471,False,Recommended,Excellent Game!First and foremost this is a stressful frenetic hide and seek game... and depending on what side you play on the gameplay varies greatly. Survivors feel very helpless and you never feel like the survivors have the upper hand. Through very very good teamwork (and luck) a survivor may be able to escape. However as the Killer you feel extremely powerful. Like a game of cat and mouse there were many times I toyed with the survivors like letting them free eachother and just having fun with them. The graphics/animations aren't the best but the environments are dark creepy and evil. The sounds are well done also from the grass crumpling under your feet or a twig snapping as you brush by to the grunts of pain when hiding or the screams of the survivors as you hang them on meat hooks. Now although there are people who can ruin the experience by disconnecting (honestly I take it as a compliment knowing they won't win so they quit . ) Don't let it deter you from playing an excellent game. The progression feels meaty as it will take a bit of time to level with a specific survivor/killer completely. For me this game is a 10/10! Absolutely love it!,Dead by Daylight

2017-06-19,0,0,713,False,Not Recommended,This is one of those games that has a tremendously great idea with potentially great gameplay using a phenominal premise.What ruins it all is the sad feeling that there must be two separate dev teams. One that came up with great ideas Asymetrical gameplay where one player plays a 70's 80's and 90's era slash movie monster and the other four play Survivors random people from random places who all got 'called' to a dark and mysterious fog filled pocket dimension where they must evade and escape and hide from the monster. Always on the lookout and watching each others back to help ensure their survival or simply letting someone die so that they themselves can escape to live another day. Always knowing that they can't run away forever from that which stalks the fog for them always waking up again after 'dying' on a sadistic meat hook when caught. There's a lot of great thematic tension in the atmosphere ... And it's absolutely ruined by the other dev team who seems to take great joy in breaking what doesn't need to be fixed... or are just suffering from Dunning Krueger syndrome ( a 'condition' or a state of being really where you think you're far more competant and capable of doing things than you really are ). For every great idea the 'other team' comes up with the second less competant and capable team either fiddles with to mess it up or panders to one side of the player base because they themselves are terrible at the game and they want to punish actual competant Killer players at high rank. I'm not going to lie once you've found your niche and possibly some friends to play with the game is a blast. You can set your own rules consciously or subconsciously ( because you wouldn't really jerk around your friends if you actually wanted friends now would you? ) so that everyone has a blast and can chat via Discord or what have you.All that goes right out the window in the online ranked play. There are an immense amount of crutches handed to Survivors that on the surface are supposed to give them a fighting chance at survival against the Killers. These are ostensibly THOROUGHLY ABUSED by the Survivor players who've built up a lot of skill and situational awareness in the gameplay. I could go on for hours but I don't want to bore anyone with what might seem like an angry rant and I don't think I have infinite space here so I'll just shorten the statement down to this The Devs have no idea how to balance the game in a way where the Killer player feels like a terrifying threat at high ranks. If you play a Killer in this game be prepared to be drowned in 'Survivor Salt' for simply EXISTING in the game. At low ranks there are more chill people either they're not as experienced or they're casual players just looking for the adrenaline rush of the chase. At higher ranks though the Survivors are not locked in a room with a Killer... the monster is locked in a room with four people who know how to abuse every single mechanic in the game for their benefit. Let me just put it this way to give you an idea of how things are to anyone who wants to debate this... The Devs to celebrate cross promotion with Left 4 Dead added Bill to the game as a free character. When they teased one of his perks they were so clueless about how to describe this perk it sounded like a get out of jail free card. It led to an actual strike among the Killer player base unwilling to deal with more yet more garbage. It was only until the actual update took place and people were allowed to read the perk's listed ability did people understand what it did and when. But to hear the devs initially describe it it sounded like the Survivors were being given literal invicibility for several seconds under certain conditions. Hell they even packaged that update with black T shirts for the Survivors ( obtainable somehow I don't know how ) that when equiped on Claudette the black girl in the Trailer video makes her invisible in most environments in the game because she blends in perfectly with dark areas. GG on that one Devs. Be prepared to see a lot of Survivor Players using that character with that shirt. Everyone I've run into playing that combo has been an utter $$H t tried tested proven.Until the Devs actually fix that stuff on top of some of the long standing bugs like the bugged pallets on MacMillon Estate maps I can't recommend the game.,Dead by Daylight

2018-03-27,0,0,388,False,Not Recommended,Okay so Dead by Daylight and I have a history as I both enjoy the game and utterly hate it at times. However a lot of what I hate about the game does come down to some of the tactics the players use. So I won t be counting those. For those who might not of played the game it s a game where one player is a killer and the other four are survivors and need to escape. Each killer and survivor can be customised with a variety of cosmetics perks and equipment. I will say right now this won t be a full comprehensive review but I will write one out and exchange the current review for the more extensive one. For the moment I ll use some points to address and list the pros and cons of the game.Pro One Survivor and Killer variety and customisation. There is no denying that there is a lot of variety when it comes to the killers and the survivors and although a great deal of it could simply be said to be cosmetic and models. The perks and load outs add to the variety and can alter the playstyle of each survivor and killer. Con One Sabotage is Useless. Okay so this is possibly my biggest issue with the game at the moment among a lot of newer issues. As I did take a long break from the game and only recently got back into it. When I first played the game roughly during the first months of it s release and maybe a little longer. I played mostly Jake Park the reason I enjoyed playing Jake was because of one of Jake s unique perks. Saboteur. Saboteur allowed Jake to sabotage hooks traps and the like without the need of a toolbox. A very useful ability that has been utterly rendered useless. Before if you had a good Jake on the team. You were fairly safe from the hooks. As Jake could go around and sabotage them rendering them useless to the killer and giving the survivors more of an advantage. The issue is that now hooks regenerate pretty damn quickly. I ve heard that apparently they regenerate after three minutes. But it feels much shorter and it renders the sabotage ability absolutely useless. Pro Two Design of the Killers. Aside from the licensed killers all killers in Dead by Daylight are pretty well designed. They each look unique and play in varying different ways. The Nurse can levitate and blink making her highly mobile the Huntress can throw hatchets giving her a rang advantage the Wraith can turn invisible the Trapper can set traps to snare unsuspecting survivors. From the design of the models to the way each of the killers play with their unique ability. The game certainly keeps it interesting and always guessing.Con Two Speed differences Now due to the fact I have been away from the game for a long time. I may be wrong on this one and if I am please say so. The issue with the speed and I don t mean the chase speed although there have been instances where the Killers have been SO MUCH faster than they probably should of been. I can put that down to certain perks within the game. What I cannot really grasp are the other times. Repair for generators has always been long and I don t mind that. But the wiggle I timed this several time and the wiggle can take anywhere between fifteen to twenty seconds. That might not seem like a long time but refer back to Con number one. Sabotage is useless. The whole point of Sabotage was to remove hooks and make it more difficult for the killer to begin the sacrifice. Now without a proper way to remove surface hooks those fifteen to twenty seconds essentially mean you are guaranteed to be hooked and will require your team mates to rescue you.This also means that the hooks in the basement the four hooks that can never be sabotaged are basically only used when the survivor goes down close enough to them.Like I said this is by no means a comprehensive review and I will be writing one during my free time and while I do really enjoy this game. I cannot deny that it is frustrating and I cannot avoid the conclusion that. While the game originally favoured the killers only moderately it also gave the survivors the skills and tools to be able to survive. Was it always fair? No not at all however now the game is punishingly unfair. The uselessness of sabotage and the massive fifteen to twenty seconds needed to wiggle out of the killers grasp. Mean that you are going to get frustrated at the game. I do like the game I would encourage people to play it so long as they can put up with it s flaws. HOWEVER I cannot recommend the game in it s current state considering how leaning it is to the killers and not more in the middle or only leaning slightly to the killers.,Dead by Daylight

2018-12-25,0,0,430,False,Recommended,Although very many people have issues with this game in terms of how it works I'm going to be straightforward and objective about this. Dead By Daylight is an assymetrical game that has 4 Survivors and 1 Killer. The Killer's objective you guess it is to kill the survivors. The Survivors on the other hand want to escape. There are many different potholes in the mechanics of the game resolving to make most players believe that Survivors have a higher skill cap than Killers and I agree. If you decide to buy this game just remember that everything will come with time. With most of the community being toxic you can't really avoid any criticism or hate. My way of enjoying this game is to play the game your way whether that would be running the Killer around (You learn how with experience) hiding from the Killer or just sitting in a locker until the gens are done. On the Killers side you can guard gens and kill Survivors normally you can be completely rude and slug the Survivors (Down them and wait for them to bleed out) or just simply be AFK until the end of the game with NOED. Both sides are fun to play once you learn strategies and builds.Overall I would rate this game a 8/10 from an objective standpoint. It is extremely fun to play from both ends as long as you know what you are doing. You can enjoy in multiple ways whether you are solo or with friends. In a subjective standpoint however this game would get a 10/10 because I want to.BTW This is my first Steam Review I'm pretty sure so how did I do? Did I make you want to buy the game? Give me some pointers in the comments! (pointers on writing reviews not about DBD.),Dead by Daylight

2017-10-27,2,5,4,False,Not Recommended,This game reminds me of payday 2.Not just cause its published by Starbreeze Or because no mater what your graphics settings the in game models always look slightly off kilter.But because like Payday 2 once the second DLC pack hits the store I can tell you exactly where this is going to go.People who don't use or benefit from the DLC are going to be mad that the DLC is over powered.People who buy the DLC are going to say its not over powered enough. And thus begins a horrible cycle of ever increasing power creep which will if it continues unabated will result in the vanilla content being unplayable when compared to the wildly powerful DLC content.The thing that made Payday 2 bareable when this happend is that its a player vs an AI controlled computer. and the computer can't complain about things being unfair and has no real concept of fairness because its not alive.But in a Player vs Player game like this one where both sides are controlled by living thinking breathing humans not only is all the atmosphere of a horror game lost but so is the all important sense of fair balance.And I don't care what the Hunter mains say. Being able to hide from you and not be spotted instantly by t detect life spells IS NOT unbalanced gameplay. Its supposed to be a hide and seek not hide and get ed because the hunter is invisable and has a spell that can reveal all other players on the map.Can't wait for the DLC that adds a survivor with a machine gun to the game.,Dead by Daylight
